name: Denver Botanic Gardens
reviews:
Whether in town for a couple days or a permanent resident of Denver, this is a MUST visit Denver attraction. The gardens are absolutely beautiful. They are open year round and every season brings something new. Additionally, they have great events ranging from music and concerts in the summer to their spring and fall markets to Blossoms of Light in the Winter. There really is something for everybody. Also, you can't go wrong grabbing a snack at their cafes.

The gardens offer a breath of fresh in the city. Its just another reason for you to spend more time outside.

This place is beautiful!!! I always get amazing photos! I have never had a bad experience here and I've been going here for as long as I can remember! This place has an amazing landscape. I would recommend if you love flowers! It is so peaceful here! You can just sit with nature and enjoy it all.

This is a very nice place to spend the day. There's so many beautiful plants and pools as well as some cool stuff for kids. I especially like the Japanese garden. It just was so peaceful. The Greenhouse area is also really cool. The plants in there are wild! Five stars!

We visited during the week and it was not crowded at all. We strolled and enjoyed taking our time. I imagine that it probably would be more lively during the spring and summer months, but we still thought most parts were beautiful. The gift shop had a wide selection of unique things, but I wish more items had “Denver Botanic Gardens” on them, so that I could have bought some souvenirs. I loved the painted canvas greeting cards, though. Overall, it was great and definitely worth the visit!

Came here after a work trip and loved it. It's a great place to sit and enjoy being outside to enjoy nature. There are several areas including a huge greenhouse and some water gardens.  The photos of this place do not do the beauty of the gardens justice.  They offer lunch there at the bistro and the food is very good.

name: Downtown Aquarium
reviews: Nice place to visit once in a while. The exhibit walk through is nice and engaging. I don’t like that you have to pay for parking and the tickets seem overpriced. I wish that you could walk through more than once but you can’t. The restaurant is beautiful, you sit next to huge fish tanks and the food is good too!

We really enjoyed our time in the aquarium.   The exhibits are well done.  We had dinner after at the restaurant.   They went out of their way to take care of us and the chief even came to our table to discuss the menu and my allergies.   They made substitutions for us.  Great service and good food.   Best new England claim chowder I have had in years.

Our kids love this aquarium. Especially the mermaid shows. That is something that we found unique here in Denver. Although the parking is not the best here (parking here is paid and across the street) we never had difficulty finding a spot and promptly get to the Aquarium. Also, a Royal Bengal Tiger in an aquarium! That was something unique too.

Very nice! Swimming in the pool with the fish, sting ray and eels was fabulous! The food from the restaurant was terrific and the birthday cake was yummy. We were there for a birthday. 🎉The exhibits were all really wonderful so cool! Plenty gifts in the gift shop. The party guides were very helpful and nice to my 2 children which was very good. Out of all the exhibits the best was the shark tank. We saw very cool sharks and people were in the pool! You should really think about going...👍

This place is a ton of fun. Not horribly priced and it’s good for kids and adults which I always enjoy. Took my boyfriend here on a date and we had a blast, a lot of cool stuff to look at and fun little interactive things to do. Just go on an off day as weekends are typically insane here

name: Denver Museum of Nature & Science
reviews: We LOVE our museum! They always have great new exhibits and the tried and true exhibits never get old. We especially enjoy the Hall of Life and make sure to check out the Expedition Health interactive short film in the back! The IMAX is also great! Don’t forget to check for Free day’s but be prepared for it to be packed. Weekdays are best and you can be sure to have the run of the museum after 3 pm. It closes at 5 pm. A must for residents and visitors alike!

Extremely wide variety of exhibits, plenty to do for kids. Workers have the most upbeat attitude and are pleased to help with any questions or interests. Clean and organized. Always have something new. Would recommend to anyone. They have free days for a variety of events and causes. Almost not enough time in one day to see all of it but worth the extra visit to see it all

Lots of cool exhibits all in one place. Overall the exhibits were very well thought out and provided a lot of interesting and fun information. The amount of detail that went into the animals in the wildlife area was amazing. Some of the interactive exhibits need a bit of an update. And in the Space Odyssey exhibit it would be nice to see the significantly high quality images available from NASA. I would definitely come back to the museum and am going to suggest it to others.

This museum covers so much, ranging from animals, science, culture and prehistoric era, etc. The work, art, and the details of the wildlife exhibits are simply amazing. I spent the entire afternoon, yet I hadn’t even read the descriptions; that tells you how big the place is and how many things you can see here. The mummy section is a little small, it’s probably better to make this theme bigger or simply remove it and change it to something else. But overall the experience is definitely a wow.

This place is so cool. The rock and gem exhibit was definitely my fave but my three year old niece preferred the adventure center for kiddos. And the space exhibit was also amazing and fun for kids and adults. Fwiw, the kids hot dog meal is definitely enough for a grown adult. A small drink, a side of tots and cucumbers, and a half lb hot dog for 5.75.

name: Denver Zoo
reviews:
Great way to learn and spend a day with family! I love that they are always working to expand and make the exhibits for the animals better. My favorite exhibit is the monkeys. I like that they have real trees to climb and can go inside and out freely. 
The food is good there as well! I would recommend the Pineapple Dole Whip, it is just like ice cream but much healthier.

The animals are easy to see with the well designed exhibits. Bring an umbrella on a hot day for shade; there are some long stretches of parts without shade. 
The zoo does a lot of animal encounters and educational shows/activities throughout the day! So fun!
Food and drink are pricey but you can bring in your own meals.

We just got a membership, and although I’d love to give 5 stars, the limited accessibility of the zoo makes it hard for me to enjoy it fully. There are several bathrooms without automated door buttons and several exhibits I could not enjoy because of my wheelchair. My kids and husband had a wonderful time, and I did too, but I can’t give it a better rating than three stars. The paths are very uneven and it’s incredibly difficult to wheel around. I would have rented a scooter but they charge $30/day!

As an Aurora Native, I have been visiting the Zoo all my life. As far as the dozen or so Zoo's I have visited, it is pretty good. They are always making improvements. My favorite attraction is Tropical Discovery (I could watch the bats all day!). The Zoo is building new attractions currently and I look forward to seeing the new Stingray exhibit. The giraffes, the primates and the pachyderms are also nicely developed. Well informed and very welcoming staff too. 🐠🦅🐧🦘🦇🐘🐫🦓🐅🐒🦏🐾🌲🌳

Great zoo. Not too big but packs a punch delivering plenty of very interesting things to see. Great place to go for an afternoon stroll and ask questions to the volunteer staff. Would absolutely recommend for children and adults alike. They also have free days so keep an eye out for them.

name: Denver Art Museum
address: 100 W 14th Ave Pkwy, Denver, CO 80204, USA
reviews:
Purchased our VIP Hotel package for the Monet exhibit which was amazing!!! We flew in from Idaho on Th and spent all day there Friday, Jan. 31, 2020. We had "dinner" at their snack bar, salad, sandwich and drink and stayed for their QUARTERLY Friday night party, with a DJ, art trivia, a glass of wine,  and another exhibit on the third floor featuring light "Entanglement".  This was a most creative exhibit.
The other building was closed for renovation until 2021, so access to their great restaurant and permanent exhibits were not available. But, we so enjoyed our main focus: the Monet exhibit. I rate it a 10. Even the building is art.  Great work Denver Art Museum staff, organizers, docents, and volunteers!!! Will return again.

This museum was very interesting. The attractions were creative to say the very least. The exhibits were all unique. There is a mirror exhibit that visitors can physically enter and see themselves reflected dozens of times over. A real play on vision. The design of the building itself is breath taking, from the inside of the building, top of the stairs...take a look down, the architecture is a work of art. This is worth the visit.

A great collection of pieces with variety, artfully grouped in themes and sub-themes. Interactive portions were plentiful and engaging. I appreciate the opportunity to come and soak in inspiration, and then be asked to create something for myself. I'm glad we allocated most of our day to our visit, and that the pass is good all day so that we could take a break for lunch and return refreshed.

I LOVE THIS PLACE! I’m actually pretty sure I’m going to do everything in my power to come back in May for the George Orwell installation! Great place to visit with or without kids! 

So many beautiful works of art of every type of medium! I also loved how they really used all of the space available to them for art work. We didn’t get to go to the sculpture garden because it was snowing but I can only imagine. We went during the week and did not have any problem with a crowd - there were even a few school groups there but they were the best behaved I’ve ever seen (good job teachers!) 

I can’t wait to become a member here (: there gift shop also has a lot of neat things to offer!

We are so lucky to have such an amazing museum here in Denver! They get some of the best exhibits in the country which people from all over come to see. The permeates collections are great too. I also like that the museum is kid friendly. I’ve been bring my nieces since they were quite young and because of their experiences here have found a love for art. Thanks DAM!!!

name: Coors Field
reviews: Although I'm a Los Angeles dodgers fan from birth you can't knock this stadium. One of the cleanest nicest friendliest places to watch baseball. One of the most incredible 4th of July fireworks you could ever attend. As much as it hurts to say go Rockies.  Just not against the dodgers. I'm a local boy now and I got respect

It's wonderful that the region has a baseball team; however, it is obvious the owners of the Rockies are satisfied with providing a team to the masses and little more. Their choice of management all the way down to the field managers makes this very clear. Too bad really but why bother because the people who have relocated to the area enjoy professional sports and the areas they came from provided professionals hell bent on winning. The Rockies? It's apparent all the owners care about is a reasonably full stadium.

So much fun! Great food options and every seat in the house is good! We have been many times and sat in all parts of the stadium. The 4th of July was a blast. I would avoid the ticket resellers outside and if you are bringing kids I would make sure to get tickets far away from the beer garden. (which is actually so cool for adults) Just loud and the smoking section is a lot. 
Great summer activity! Go ROCKIES!

For someone who really isn't a large Baseball fan this Stadium was massively entertaining and had some of the most tasty american treats to eat. Took a tour of the full facility and the top lounge bar was a nice touch. Would recommend visiting even if you're not a fan of the sport. A+ Treatment and Food!

Figured I'd come back here and give Coors Field a 5 stat rating after they hosted an awesome stadium series between the Avalanche and Red Wings in 2016. After going to the stadium series in Colorado Springs last night I kept thinking how Coors Field did an awesome job. No lines for beer or washrooms and the pro shop is awesome too.

name: Molly Brown House Museum
reviews: If you're a fan of the story of Titanic, you'll enjoy this place. There's a gift shop behind the house (where tour tickets are purchase) filled with interesting Titanic souvenirs. A ticket costs less than $15 and a tour lasts for about 1 hour. A very knowledgeable tour guide named Bennett was with us. Highly recommended if you're in the downtown Denver area and need to kill a few hours.

What a fun little tour! The house is incredible and the story of Margaret Brown is neat. We had time to kill while in Denver so we started doing a little searching of things to do when touring the house of Margaret Brown came up. Did a little searching on who she was and was like "I had no idea! Lets go!" Id you don't know who Margret Brown is, she was one of the survivors of the Titanic. She is even portrayed in the Movie. (Not accurately, but you will have to go do the tour to know why I say that.)

Really enjoyed seeing such a unique bit of history. The house is well preserved and getting the guided tour absolutely made for a great experience. Not great for small kids. However my teenagers really enjoyed the short tour.

While I was thrilled to see the inside of the house, I was disappointed with the actual tour. I felt the information was kind of generic and I wished it was a bit more specific/educational. I enjoyed my visit, I just wish it was a better tour. We also couldn’t see the 3rd floor because they were doing training. Why have training in a place where you’re preventing visitors from going there?

A beautiful museum that tells the story of an amazing and inspirational woman. A must see for everyone, especially those who live in Colorado. I had a great time learning about this historic location, and will surely return to share this experience with others!

name: Wings Over the Rockies Air & Space Museum
address: 7711 E Academy Blvd, Denver, CO 80230, USA
reviews: What a unique and interesting place to go visit! It's an amazing experience to be so close to the actual planes. Just the amount of history in one building is amazing. They do a great job explaining the types of airplanes and what they were built for. May not hold the interest of smaller children, but they do a good job of keeping things there for all ages.
We had several companies celebrating here. Was wonderful, fun and interesting. Excellent space for such. However would also recommend for family or school outing visit.

As you can see my husband enjoyed himself here. I think anyone who, as a as a child dreamed of flying planes are going into space, would enjoy themselves here. My only complaint would be that they need to do more interactive programs with the aircraft. But definitely a great way to spend a few hours.

This may be a super cool place if you have a love for aviation. I have been spoiled with seeing many museums over the years. If you have visited the Air & Space in DC or the Air and Space Annex in the DC area this will be a huge disappointment.  If you have not experienced any similar ones, then this would be a good first one to see.
I took my son and we spent three wonderful hour here. Very interesting and educational place. Would definitely recommend visiting!

name: Forney Museum of Transportation
reviews: We spent the afternoon in Denver with my Dad.  He loves trains, planes and automobiles.  This was a really cool exhibit.  If you haven't been you really should go.  This visit they featured LOWRIDERS.  All sorts of modifications and artwork.  Indian motorcycle fans would be impressed.  And they have one of the Union Pacific Big Boys.  Much more than this short list.  Takes a couple of hours tops for the casual visitor to appreciate one of Denver's hidden gems.

Fabulous museum to transport, just near Denver city centre. It covers all forms of transport and has some impressive exhibits. They have the massive "Big Boy" train, cars, planes, bikes and more. There is ample parking and friendly staff, plus it was good value for money

This was a great experience! The museum has so many artifacts and it's easy to follow. Al took the time to talk to us about our many interests and told us many facts about the museum. It was a great way to spend a Sunday afternoon. Thank you and we will be back.

So manny awesome things to see on display here. I will definitely be coming back. If you enjoy cars/transportation this is the place to check out while in Denver. Super nice staff. Super historical displays.

I haven't been to the Forney museum since I was a child and it's quite a bit different than I remember. It's still need to see all the old vehicles and be able to walk through some of the old trains, But I did take a star away because it just seems like it's on its last legs and there isn't much anyone is trying to do to save it

name: History Colorado Center
reviews: Went here for a lecture on historic beer but dropped by early to check out the museum. And I am so happy we did! They had thoughtful exhibits that covered large ranges of Colorado history. The Beer exhibit we went for was awesome and we loved watching the old Coors commercials.

It's the best interactive museum I've ever been to. If you have kids, this place is a must. Overseas visitors - insight into history and future
There are a lot of things from the past - some are visual and when others are tactile. We spent 3 very interesting hours there. Would highly recommend visiting!

Awesome museum you can potentially spend a whole day in. Plenty of historical stuff as well as rotating exhibits of things like the school kid art exhibition that was being installed when we arrived. During our weekday visit there were lots of school groups so be prepared for that.

I loved the exhibit about beer, especially the vintage Coors ads. My family has worked at and distributed Coors beer so I have a bit of a personal tie but even if I didn't I think I would have gotten a kick out of the 1970s era "mountain man & woman" (this ain't no flat lander beer) ads

We came to the History Colorado Center for the first time today and were thoroughly impressed. The exhibits are awesome, the staff was great, plenty to do for both kids and adults, and the cafe had A+ food. Prices are reasonable too. This is a great gem in Denver!

We went with our kiddos on their field trip. We didn't know what to expect. It was awesome! So much history. My husband and i were pleasantly surprised. Great tour guide and very interactive. Lots of hands on learning(even for adults). So excited to go back!

name: Colorado State Capitol
address: 200 E Colfax Ave, Denver, CO 80203, USA
reviews: Free entrance and if time permit, do sign up for the free tour as it allow you entry into the dome. Our tour guide Maddy was excellent and provided interesting fact about the building and some notable person in the history of Denver. I enjoy it more than expected. The staff are helpful and friendly. The interior of the building are majestic and grand, and as a first time visitor to the states, it is also fascinating to learn more about the how the voting procedure is done.

Great educational place! Very detailed history and well maintained. Many interesting things inside of the capital building itself. I recommend the free guided tour to go in detail about the history. Also, try to avoid busy times and school groups. The Senate and House of Representatives chambers were my favorite!! I recommend this place for sure!!!

The state capitol building is beautiful, and while one can wander around and see the building, I highly recommend stopping by the visitors desk and taking a tour. The tour took about 45 minutes, and was fantastic! We went from ground floor to the dome (walked around outside). The guide shared lots of things I would have missed. Extremely worthwhile!
Cool place to visit. The tour guide was awesome and super informative. Definately worth the stop. The tour is about an hour long and ends at the top observation deck.

Colorado's state capital is one of the cooler state capital buildings I have visited. Really great exterior and interior with nice landscape. Everything is really interesting with a bunch of different history all over the building. It is usually open to the public and they do tours throughout the day. If you are in the tour you get to go much higher in the building then just visiting. Cool place!

name: Washington Park
address: 701 S Franklin St, Denver, CO 80209, USA
reviews: Beautiful touch of green in the city. Worth going for a walk just to see all the amazing homes that line the park! Lack of restrooms and water fountains though, although it was out of season. Not a while lot of parking spaces, but should be able to find on-street pretty close if necessary.

We were visiting town and had to stop by the famous wash park. It was nice, spacious. The amenities aren’t redone or super new but everything is functional. The kids had fun at the playground. What else can you ask for? The neighborhood surrounding it is pretty nice too.

What a lovely gem of a place this is! It's a great place to people watch, and walking by the bodies of water here is a serene experience. Great for nice long walks, jogs, and bike rides. They even have a rec center in the park that's 6 dollars a day for a visit.  Definitely a great place to spend an entire day!

Truly Denver's iconic unofficial answer to Olympic running training! One of the best places in the metro area to train on a secured route, there are both paved loops and a dirt trail loop along the edge. These supply a good distance as well, measuring approximately 2.2 miles and 2.5 miles respectively.
With landscaped flower beds and an impressive tree line and 2 ponds, it is quite a beautiful park as well! Plenty of activities for kids and picnics and lots of volleyball during the warmer months. So it's a great family place, and like so many great places in Denver, is quite well-known with locals and tourists alike so typically a decent-sized crowd on a warm sunny weekend! And for the record, if you really want to head out during the night for a nice cool dark run, you will always have some company! Truly a year round, 24 hour approachable training Park!

What a great place to go. Nice view of the pond, nice neighborhood and 2 walking/running trails. Great for social gathering, work out, a picnic or a date. Gets plenty crowded on the beautiful days so be prepared, lots of people and dogs

name: Kirkland Museum of Fine & Decorative Art
reviews:
When I was planning my visit I saw this museum and it was top on my list. Kirkland did not disappoint. First, the building is beautiful, and the staff was incredibly friendly. The museum packs a lot of amazing design history inside and does a great job of it. Unsurprisingly, the layout is well thought out. The rooms along the promenade walk you through the history and evolution of design better than any history class or any other museum I have seen. The museum is set up more like a furniture store or the home of a collector than a white-walled modern art museum.  Each room offers a holistic glimpse into that era of design. The items are presented in a way you rarely see at other museums, in a more natural and contextual space. 

The studio space feels like it is still someones home. It does not feel like much was changed to make it a museum. The smaller space and more natural layout makes for a unique experience. A fantastic museum filled with a great history.

If you’re a lover of fine arts and design, this is a MUST see. Absolutely stunning collection filled with the most beautiful artifacts collected from all over the world. Immaculately maintained and displayed. From stills to prints, sculptures small and large, it is the single best collection of unique and forward thinking art and design anywhere in the world.

Went during Denver arts week which happens during the first Saturday of November where multiple art museums graciously open up their doors for free between 5-10pm.

Museum admission is not expensive on most other days and it’s a fantastic way to spend some time and taking in the breathtaking modern art pieces with many that transcend time and still can be considered pieces that should not be missed hundreds of years later.

My hubby and I are art lovers. We decided to visit this museum to get some inspiration. We were pleasantly surprised by the beauty of the paintings and the enthusiasm of the staff. We are waiting for a new exhibition in February. Would highly recommend visiting this awesome museum!
So much to appreciate, and all new to me. Loved the furniture styles and glasswork. The discussion of synesthesia was especially interesting.

I was in Denver on a Final Friday and this was on the art Walk list. The listing seemed like a museum dedicated to Vince Kirkland, but its actually a portion of a massive collection of many modern artists with connection to Denver like Andy Worhol. Imagine the finest estate sale of a modern art collector. It would be nice to have a docent tour of all these distinctive pieces or better yet a virtual reality tour. There's a lot of interesting stories to be told here.

name: Clyfford Still Museum
reviews: The best artist you've never heard of. He stopped showing his work and continued to paint and create for years. He gifted all of his paintings to a trust with the condition that they create a museum with only his art. His story is  much more nuanced and complicated but he really was a rebel, even among the rebels he hung out with (Pollock, Rothko, etc.). Definitely worth taking your time here.

I stumbled onto the Clyfford Still Museum after visiting the Denver Art Museum and I was completely blown away.  The paintings and his story are breathtaking.  The building is beautiful and being surrounded by these enormous achingly gorgeous paintings is an experience.  I was not a fan of abstract expressionism but this museum and exhibits help me “get it”.  The exhibit rotates every couple months or so.  And the current exhibit is spectacular - one room had noise cancelling headphone and putting them on and just looking at the paintings in the complete silence was the most peaceful and stress relieving experiences I’ve had.

Really enjoyed the art... read about the art as much as the artist's life to fully appreciate the museum. The building itself is beautiful - many interesting angles from inside and outside that let light through. Look for their evening discount if you're flexible with your schedule and want to save.

Magnificent architecture. There are 3 different concrete finishes compose the whole building. The combinations creates many interesting feeling in the museum. Art work is amazingly beautiful. It’s one of the jewel of museum!

The staff was incredibly knowledgeable and helpful, yet they were unobtrusive unless you appeared to have a question. The premise was clean clearly labeled and wonderfully aesthetic.  The displays are logically configured and placed for maximum impact.  I have been to many museums but this one stands above. I highly recomend a visit.

name: Children's Museum of Denver at Marsico Campus
address: 2121 Children's Museum Dr, Denver, CO 80211, USA
reviews: Always a great place for kids to encourage learning and exploration. So much to do and experience! Ours have always loved the bubble room and areas they can play and draw. Plenty of activities inside and out to keep the whole family entertained

Great place for kids! There are plenty of different areas for kids to play in. There is even an area for younger kids with age appropriate toys. There is a cooking class that you can sign up for throughout the day and make a healthy snack with your kid for free! On inclement weather days it does get very busy.

Excellent children’s museum- and we have been to dozens and dozens! The things that really make this museum stand out from others are 1. Adventure Forest- it’s like you fall inside a piece of artwork and physically go on the adventure that was happening in the artist’s head. This, alone, is worth the price of admission. (Must be 5yo or 44”) 2. Teaching Kitchen- quick, easy, fun cooking classes for all ages! Just sign up the day you visit. 3. Workshop- kids love getting their hands on actual tools and finding out what they can do. The self-contained stations allow families to work independently without checking tools out from a staff member or waiting for a turn with a tool or making too much of a chaotic mess. Supervision obviously important here. 4. The art studio has unique features like real clay, chalk paint, and the opportunity to paint large sculptures that stay in the studio.

I LOVE the Children's Museum for so many reasons. Children and growing their brains is number one! But their event team is stellar and spaces are bright, light and airy with tons of options that you wouldn't expect! And it is centrally located in downtown Denver with parking!

Wonderful place to take young children. Could use a dedicated coffee spot for the parents/grandparents and always SUPER crowded, but I think that only speaks to how fun it is for littles. Buying the pass is worth it if you can go often. We love it here.

name: Stranahan's Colorado Whiskey
address: 200 S Kalamath St, Denver, CO 80223, USA
reviews:
I'm not the biggest Stranahan's drinker. I like your stuff and I think you make a great product. The taste is just not my favorite. I'll never turn down a free dram though!

That being said, the facility, lounge, shop and tour were all fantastic. Logan was very knowledgeable and entertaining. You guys have a great thing going. Keep it up and thanks for the experience.

What were we thinking doing two distillery tours in one afternoon?!? I tell you what, it was totally worth it. I'm not much of a whiskey drinker, but you have to check out Stranahan's Colorado Whiskey.

We had some time before the tour, so we bellied up to the bar. Steve B., mixologist and server, was really cool and explained the drinks to us. When it was time for the tour, we were introduced to Logan. He was an awesome tour guide, and has a great personality for it. He gave us a history of Stranahan's as well as what it takes to make their whiskey.

During the tour, we were given some samples. Again, not being a whiskey drinker, I was surprised at how you go about tasting it. And it wasn't bad! Logan even showed us what happens to the whiskey when you add a little bit of water to it. We were able to keep our tasting glass as a souvenir, and some of our group took advantage of the discount after the tour to bring home a bottle or two!

My girlfriend and I are in from Chicago and decided to do the guided tasting tour and we got Kevin as the leader of our tour. He was super knowledgeable about the process, the product, and broke it down easy for us to understand. We've been to other distilleries in other states and Kevin was one of our better guides. The stemless Glencarn glass was a great souvenir to receive at the end. Diamond Peak is the best!

I bought tickets for the tour for my boyfriend on his birthday. It was us and a couple friends. We had an absolute blast! Dave was very knowledgeable, passionate and funny. He made the tour very interesting and enjoyable. He taught some of us first timers how to enjoy Stranahan's and other whiskeys properly. Cool place to hang out and enjoy a whiskey. They have games at their bar too. I highly recommend!!

Do the tour! Their guides are well versed on the brand and are awesome storytellers. The tasting room is gorgeous as well, if you want to just stop in a for a drink without the tour.  If you get as lucky as I did and get selected for a bottling, make whatever arrangements need to be made to attend! It was an awesome experience overall! The staff was fun, they give you breakfast and lunch for the morning crew, as well as a sample each time the crew filled a pallet! Very cool that all their bottles are done by volunteers. Highly recommend!

name: Confluence Park
reviews: The park and its associated running paths are a spectacular addition to downtown Denver. You may have to dodge a tipped scooter here and there but it's a peaceful place to picnic or stop for a breather while on a jog. There's practically no city noise and it seems fairly safe, at least in daylight.

Really nice, well designed, and well maintained park on the banks of the river. Great for leisurely strolls, dog walking, and picnics. Not sure if you can canoe, didn't seem like it. Also has a good view of the Denver skyline.

Even in the winter months it never ceases to amaze me. The sound of the water drowns the fast traffic right above. Plenty of people here biking, skating, runners and even a few practicing their rafting skills. A great place to visit anytime.
Nice place the river was rushing through, people were actually Fly Fishing too. It was cool. I was blessed with fantastic weather too

This is a nice urban park right where the South Platte River and Cherry Creek converge, hence the name. The cascading water and the city skyline make for a postcard perfect scene. This place is quite historic too - it's around this spot where early prospectors started looking for gold, triggering a gold rush that would mark the beginning of Denver as we know it. Really neat when you learn something new as you discover new places.

name: Cathedral Basilica of the Immaculate Conception
reviews: The architecture on this place is unbelievable and it feels like a castle! I'm not sure about parking as we are walking this day but I look forward to coming back to visit sometime in the future. It is nice that Denver has such a beautiful location in the heart of the city and capital. Found this beautiful little squirrel close to outside. Have a wonderful day!

This Cathedral was gorgeous. I didn't actually go inside but I sat outside it for about an hour in awe of the excellent architecture. What a lovely view. I'm writing this review based solely on the external aesthetics, which were absolutely lovely. I recommend for this alone. But upon now seeing the internal pics now, I see this place is just a wonder all around.
Gorgeous cathedral. Neo Gothic style is beautiful day or night. Our priest had a very good homily and the choir and pipe organ were great.
Mass here is always beautiful. The music at 6:30p service is uplifting.  They used a different incense yesterday.  The smell lingers on what I wear and brings the peacefulness back.

It was Christmas eve midnight mass. My first time in Catholic  church in more than four years and my first time in the Cathedral. If you have never been it's stunning. The music was incredible  and the Archbishop's word was exactly what I needed to hear.

name: National Ballpark Museum
reviews: I took my youngest son, who is a baseball history fanatic, and he was welcomed with open arms. He loved holding bats swung by Ted Williams and Mickey Mantle and taking in all the unique baseball treasures. The staff were warm, enthusiastic, and patient as my son delighted in fanning them with an array of trivia questions. The founder's love of baseball history emerged from every corner.  This is a unique museum and a great way to spend some quality time with the baseball lover in your life.  Also conveniently located in a special part of downtown Denver!
Unique collection of artifacts. Compact but thorough set up. Great stop before a Rockies game. Extremely friendly staff.

Wow! Such a great place, jam packed with information. The people who work there know so much and have great stories. If your a baseball fan you should stop by doesnt take long to complete but every spot is filled with throwback history about baseball.
Fun place for baseball fans to spend a few minutes in downtown Denver!

If you love baseball and you're in Denver, check out the ballpark museum! It's got so much stuff its overwhelming.  The tours are usually unguided, but we had an employee come around and highlight and explain some of the stuff which was amazing.  There is a good mix between ballpark and player history to be seen, several Babe Ruth balls, a personal tax return from the Babe, and all kinds of neat stuff.  Take all the pictures you want too, so you can relive the memory forever!

name: Museum of Contemporary Art Denver
reviews: Absolute favorite museum in Denver. Love all the exhibitions they get here I became a member here because it’s so reasonable and totally worth it!! Their “rooftop” bar is also a lot of fun, especially in summer. I love this place, never have a complaint. Staff is also always very very friendly and extremely helpful.

What a nice museum to visit in Downtown Denver. The exhibitions are interesting and well described in English and Spanish. An audio guide would be nice. The building itself is a piece of art. Make sure you explore. Suggest you take the stairs to the 3rd floor and enjoy a libation in the cafe and take in the nice downtown views on the rooftop. Check out their website for events, activities and current exhibitions. $10 for adults. $7 for seniors and students.

A great immersive space for thought-provoking contemporary art! The staff is so friendly and warm and the shows they represent take you through the full spectrum of emotions. Space Elevate you and your perception of the city around you. They have wonderfully eclectic events I always feel like it's an art Escape within the city
Cheap price for entry with a large space. Targets a very unique brand of artist that may not be your cup of tea, but for the price it's worth the risk. We spent two hours browsing.

Came in for one of the Friday Tours and will be back ASAP. We were on a tight schedule and weren’t able to stick around for long after the tour. There is so much more to explore. The tour guide gave an amazing perspective and point of view.

name: Sprightly Escapes: The Denver Escape Room Experience
reviews: Sprightly does an amazing job at creating a unique escape room experience full of interesting puzzles. I appreciated that the puzzles and challenges were low tech, and didn’t rely on fancy gimmicks in order to be clever. Their clue system is also really brilliant. The themes for each room are well thought out. I’ve done 2 of the 3 rooms they currently offer and will definitely be back to play the third room. Lucas has an obvious excitement for his business and does a great job with all aspects of the work involved. Also, I really love that every customer gets to shine on the photo walls, not just the top finishers. It’s a tangible display of appreciation for their customers that you just don’t see anywhere else. Certainly one of the top escape room businesses in Denver!

Great fun for all ages!! Owner, Lucas, is a polite and friendly gaming nerd :).  Between my daughter and I, we have done all 3 rooms.  Rooms have a bunch of puzzles that are challenging for all levels.

So much fun! We have now completed two escape rooms at Sprightly Escapes. Both have been excellent and innovative with fantastic and fun puzzles and themes. Lucas was so welcoming and encouraging. He let us reserve the room just for ourselves even though our group did not comprise the maximum number of people allowed in the room.  Sprightly Escapes is our favorite escape room experience in Denver!

It was my first time doing an escape room and it was a great experience. The puzzles were challenging but not impossible, and the game master made the entire thing amazing. The game master (i feel bad that I can’t remember his name) did a great job of explaining things in the beginning and of giving us just the right amount of help when we were lost. I’ll gladly return!
We had an amazing time here while visiting Denver! Gave us something fun to do together!

name: Sloan's Lake Park
address: 1700 N Sheridan Blvd, Denver, CO 80212, USA
reviews: I love going for my daily walk around the lake. Such a beautiful walk after a long day. People are always working out. It’s a long walk. It’s great place to start working out. Fun festive during the summer time. Great place to take the whole family. Just have to remember it is a lake so you have to pay attention with the little ones and pets.

A large park with a large lake surrounded by walking paths. The park has restrooms stationed around, fairly equidistant from each other. The park has shops and food along half of it's perimeter and residential on the other. The bathrooms are heated during the winter. Lots of benches and open space to hang out with friends and have activities. It's quite a popular park all year round. Plenty of pokestops and gyms for Pokemon go too!

Really lovely park to go for a walk or sit on a blanket and watch all the people and dogs. The paved path around the lake is a little under three miles. Lots of bird to enjoy, and you might even see a bald eagle in the colder months.
The Sloan Lake is beautiful and worthwhile a visit if you are around Denver Metro area. Good for walking, biking, skating, etc. There is free parking available and places for picnic. Lovely park!

Awful!!!! Haven't been to this park in years so my daughter and I decided to take our bikes and have a good time riding around the lake....well that didn't happen because it took us almost 15 minutes just to find parking spot plus ones we were ready we find out that you almost couldn't even walk. I miss the good old days.

name: City Park
reviews: City Park is a great place to visit in Denver. The park is very large and clean. We love to watch the animals, especially the birds and dogs all year long. The playground is definitely a favorite for my son and his friends here in the Denver metro area.

City Park is amazing. There is abundant space to play around in, multiple play areas for children to engage in, and its upkeep is second to none. If you're looking for something a park might offer, this one has it. It is massive, so you might have to go around a bit to find the thing you're after, and you'll find it to be worthwhile.

Part of a larger complex of public space well maintained by South Suburban Parks and recreation district. Adjacent to Littleton war memorial rose garden. Recently upgraded all ages playground. Lots of geese so don't let the kids roll in the grass!

Best farm to start the holiday season off at. Fun things for the kids, animals to feed, and the best pumpkins to carve!!
It has become a family tradition to come to Finks every year!!
Great park! One of the 2 big parks in Denver area. Lots of things around and in the park to do. This is one of the most Romantic Views of the Sunset in the City. Totally reccomend it for that.

name: American Museum of Western Art--The Anschutz Collection
reviews: Thanks to the Anschutz family for making such a magnificent collection available for public viewing. In addition to their value as fine art, the paintings—mostly oils—have historic importance as depictions of life in the West prior to photographs or when photography was still in its infancy. Just a couple of drawbacks: The building, though charming, is too small for the collection, so that the paintings are crammed literally from floor-to-ceiling. This makes it hard to get a good view of paintings that are too high or too low. Moreover, the lighting relies mostly on traditional spotlights that create shiny bright spots on some of the works, especially those near the ceiling. Nevertheless, a memorable and worthwhile experience!
Great docent-led tour but no photos allowed. Some great artists in the collection but I realized I’m not a fan of “salon-style” installations.  I would prefer a different style of curation.
By far the best museum in Denver - intimate but full of amazing works. Recommend a private tour.

The historic Navarre building, across the street from the Brown Palace, houses this museum and is the home of the Anschutz Collection. There are more than 600 paintings, drawings, and sculptures from almost 200 artists. The collection offers a survey of western art from the dawn of the 19th century to the present. Billionaire Philip Anschutz sent portions of this collection on tours of foreign countries, including China and the Soviet Union, to promote American Exceptionalism. In 2010, he founded the museum to exhibit the collection to the American public. 
	
The museum's floor plan is simple: three large, open rooms on three floors. The range of styles is eclectic. There are examples of "early American expeditionary painting, Hudson River School and Rocky Mountain School landscapes, 19th-century American narrative painting, early American modernism, Expressionism, Cubism and Abstraction, American Regionalism, New Deal Art, and Abstract Expressionism." That's from the museum's website. I certainly couldn't identify them all myself, and the collection is not organized by approach, but presented salon-style. The overall impression is of a rich and contradictory heritage, almost too much to digest in one trip. 
	
I must admit to my own contradictory feelings about this museum. The collection is stunning, certainly, but the founder, one of the wealthiest men in the U.S., is a conservative Christian who actively opposes equal rights for our LGBTQ citizens. Should his politics be a factor for people who might visit the museum? Or should that be set aside, for the sake of the art? 
	
I'm not sure. I went, and I enjoyed the visit. And... I left with feelings of ambivalence. Ambivalence about the history of the west, and about the owners of this collection. 
	
If you go, take the guided tour. It's a must. Our own guide was extremely knowledgeable - and necessary, to be honest. There's so much to see - almost too much! 
	
Another valuable resource is an excellent piece from Westword, which discusses the history of the Navarre building as well as the evolution of the museum within. Look for "Philip Anschutz Opens His Substantial Collection of Western Art to the Public" by Michael Paglia, in Westword's May 29, 2012 issue. 
	
Photos are not allowed within the museum, so my photos here are all of the exterior. A quick online search will show you the interior and the splendid - if perhaps slightly overpowering - artwork on display. On the second floor, look for the portrait of George Washington; it is from 1823 and is the oldest piece in the museum’s collection.

Meuseum was amazing. We browsed the museum for hours. Entry was only $5 and also had a recorded description of the paintings and thier creators. 

We actilually came to the museum to find out more about the building. It has a rich history. My great grandfather purchased a grandfather clock when the owner at the time sold everything to move back to his county. The clock was in the building back when it was a school and/or bordelo. The clock was built in the 1800s as a train clock. Very accurate and used by others to set thier time pieces too...so I was told. 

Clock has been modified with top and side shelves since (not sure when or by who) but a great piece of history and today is in my entryway. I was hoping to find pics of the building from that period and one with the clock in it. That would have been incredible. Works great.

name: ROOM 5280 - Denver Live Escape Games
reviews: Great time solving the Sherlock Room. As a fan of Sherlock, I enjoyed the homage. As a fan of puzzles, I thought this one was well put together. The staff provided a great service and knew just when to give us a nudge when we were getting ahead of ourselves.

Our family has developed a small addiction to escape rooms in the last year, and we decided to give 5280 a try before a few of us have to return home from the holiday break. We were greeted by a very friendly staff member (owner?) who signed is in with ease and explained the rules of the Sherlock Room with thoroughness and a positive attitude. I especially appreciated her patience with a toddler in our group who was flinging themselves around the room while we were being briefed. In general the service and approachability here is excellent and they really do put in the extra effort to make you feel welcome and engaged. The Sherlock Holmes room itself was good, but not great, particularly compared to some other Colorado escape rooms we've visited. The puzzles were decently designed, but the room felt sparse, and the use of an electronic intercom interface suspended reality a little bit. We found most of the puzzles to be creative except for the final two which were either obvious (though we were told it stumps some groups) or a little tedious (although still very cleverly designed.) In all, I'd recommend it, and I know our group is excited to try their more challenging Heist room.

What a fun adventure at ROOM 5280! I knew it was going to be interesting to try to get out. Seeing how our differences became our strengths was so cool. Great instructions and details that made this an awesome escape room 👍

A fun, challenging experience. This was my first time in an escape room, and my group was in the “Heist” room. The puzzles along the way required some thought as well as trial and error, but they weren’t overly complicated. Would recommend for a group of friends or family.
You can tell when an owner cares, it shows in the layout and puzzles! Highly recommended!!

name: Balistreri Vineyards
reviews:
This venue was perfect and all that we could have wanted. We also used their catering service and the food was delicious! I highly recommend serving their red sangria as one of your drinks are your wedding. YUMMMY!!
Thank you Julie and her wedding planners! Mattie and Lauren! You all were so amazing and accommodating!
Great food and great wine. They have free wine tasting and let you try everything they have. They also offer free winery tours.

We had our wedding at Balistreri in September and it was AMAZING! Balistreri is a hidden gem and was the perfect venue for us.  Both the ballroom and the outdoor area were gorgeous, and the food provided by Balistreri was delicious!  We served Balistreri's white sangria during the ceremony/cocktail hour and it was definitely a crowd-pleaser, as was the other Balistreri wine we served.  The staff at Balistreri is very relaxed and accommodating, and really allowed us to make our day what we wanted. Huge shout out to Lauren and Mattie who were very easy to work with, responsive, and extremely helpful in coordinating everything for us!   We have had numerous guests tell us that this was one of the best weddings they have attended, which can be largely attributed to this great venue.

It has great wines to drink.  It serves lite lunch, brunch to share and other up scale plates. You can also taste the 🍷, then purchase a bottle of your favorite.  This is located in Commerce City, so it takes a bit for some people to get used to the 👃.  Also, it is pricey, so bring your wallet or credit card.
I love this place! Great wine and food. Also great event services. I had my wedding reception and rehearsal dinner here. Definitely my go to place. I always bring friends and family here 😄

name: Denver Firefighters Museum
reviews: A fun little museum! Especially for kiddos or those who love a little history... Old engines, the history of firefighting in Denver, a play area for kids w costumes, a mini fire pole & fire engine to play on! A wonderful place for children to learn 911 calling & fire safety skills while having fun!

Of course we love going to all museums and love learning new things, however this place is super small. Our 3 year old loved the play firefighter's truck, but I don't think it was geared towards kids/activities were lacking. I could not imagine paying to visit, luckily we had a free pass.

Small, but very interesting. My kids loved trying on the costume fire fighter gear and seeing where they slept. Parking is not included, but there are pay spots along the road. They have items I have never seen in person before and was pleasantly suprised with the attention to detail. Overall would definitely recommend the trip.

My 7yo grandson didn't want to leave!  He put on all the kid-sized firefighter gear provided, including a Fire Chief hat, sat in the driver's seat of the big red fire truck and his imagination drove him to a whole new dimension. Lots of interactive play for everyone... very well thought out design of the museum for any age to enjoy.

The Firefighter Museum was a nice stop while we were in Denver. The staff was nice and my husband as well as my 4 year old loved ed it. They had items children could touch and play with. Dress up like a firefighter and upstairs plan an escape route if there was a fire in a home.

name: United States Mint
address: 320 W Colfax Ave, Denver, CO 80204, USA
reviews: Great place to get back to the patriotic self and feel proud of how humanity evolved over time.

Super cool tour. You get to see the actual coin mints in operation, with giant piles of penny and quarter blanks being converted to freshly-minted currency right before your eyes! However, hours are very limited and tour tickets are in high demand, so getting in is a pain. Planning ahead is essential. Read the website and other reviews carefully. My pro-tip suggestion is to go during the winter off season if you can. I went on a 9:30 am tour on a snowy November, and still arrived at 7am to ensure I got tickets.

Tickets are free and are first come, first serve. Arrived at 9:30, and got tickets for the 12:30 tour. Have to arrive 30 minutes before tour to go through security. No bags allowed. If visiting during summer months or spring break, arrive at 5 am as tickets will be gone by 7:10am. Ticket window opens at 7am. Tour itself was ok... Not sure what I was expecting, it's a guided tour mixed in with self guided bits. After the guide says their script, you're free to roam around and read the information panels.. they give you plenty of time to read everything, maybe too much time.. there is a feeling of waiting around in between each room.. staff is super friendly but I do think the tour could be a bit more animated and interactive. Would I line up at 5am during peak season, no way... Off peak, why not. :) There is $12 and $13 (all day or $5-6 per hour)  parking nearby. Walking distance to the capital and other sites as well.
This is a really fun place to visit. You get to watch money being made and can even take a bag of shredded money as a souvenir.

Beautiful, and Historical. From the coin collection observed on tour to the building itself. Plan ahead, as to not be disappointed. Tickets are available for all tour times starting at 7 am. Everyone in line at 7 was getting tickets for tours scheduled throughout the day.

name: Denver Millennium Bridge
reviews: Wonderful area to walk around, I took my friend here today to enjoy the warm weather. Highly recommend exploring Union Station, Tattered Cover and some of the nicest restaurants in Denver!!
Bridges really aren't my thing but my wife wanted to see it. It was nice and looked like a engineering challenge. Goes over a railroad track or should I say about 5 Railroad tracks
A place to make memories. So many of mine have been made there. I was 12 years old my first time passing it and for many a great 4th of July fireworks view!!!
Very cool structure, definitely not just any old city bridge. Nice views and places to sit.

It's a bridge.... what's not to love. Kind of at gateway to commons park or to the sixteenth street Mall. Access to the free mall ride.  Oh ya... it's an architectural feature downtown that makes for great photos.

name: Center for Colorado Women's History at the Byers-Evans House Museum
reviews:
Great museum pretty close to downtown easily accessible via public transportation. A museum that contains an immaculately maintained home with many artifacts that were handed down for multiple generations and still flawless after many years. The tour guides give a rich history and have in depth knowledge of the many different artifacts around the house.

Went during Denver arts week which happens during the first Saturday of November where multiple art museums graciously open up their doors for free between 5-10pm.

Museum admission is not expensive on most other days and it’s a fantastic way to explore some history and immerse yourself in the life of someone with a house built almost 150 years ago.

We were given free passes after visiting the main History Colorado Museum a day earlier. The house can only be visited via a guided tour, and we called ahead to make sure there's spots for us.

The house is definitely beautiful and looks remarkably well preserved. The docent shared a lot of interesting tidbits about the Evans family and the household items they left behind, but didn't really demonstrate the connection between the family and women's history in the state. There is a small gallery at the reception, but I also didn't notice any mention of the Evanses in that gallery.

The home of a family who had great impact to the Denver area in terms of art and women's rights during the late 1800s to the early 1900's. This original and very well kept home is very interesting archectually and the original pieces of furniture, art, books, etc. give a real sense of the histories of the families that owned the home.
Very nice place!
This is a beautiful home with rich history. Our tour guide, Judy, was very knowledgeable about the house and the families that lived there. This was definitely a highlight of our trip!

name: Big Blue Bear
reviews:
On the night prior to November 5th, 2019, that Big Blue Bear had been peeking through the great window, trying desperately to catch any glimpse of mystical performance from Devi enchantress, Ms. Lana Del Rey, but alas, she already achieved night's completion, for I'd just exited the venue & never would I have allowed myself a premature ejection from her concert grounds; Not while Supreme Goddess of All Heaven & Earth still graced me in her divine song.

But, oh, such poor, poor Blue Bear... If it had been me standing out there in so much cold, gazing hopeless such deep void lying just beyond that wall of glass encasement, to be filled only with what emptiness makes when so greatly a loss felt, I would have been reeking havoc all over the damn place, being extreme mean throughout that downtown scene, like when in videogame demolition mode from a sin of Rampage play. But such helluva nice Bear, was Big Blue, who refused to take out these erupting emotions of hostility, anguish, & disappointment on the littler, though taxpaying, citizens of Denver, CO.

He is so cool to see! So beautiful, very bright and pretty big, he is also very cute as he is peaking into the colorado convention center. Must see if you are anywhere near downtown! There are a few benches around him, it is worth sitting and pondering the meaning of life. Just saying.
Towering public art so it's hard to miss. I've never seen anything like this anywhere, and I thought it was well done. NOT tacky or an eyesore at all.

Big blue bear is an iconic figure in Denver downtown. This place is near the Colarado convention center where some of the science conference taking place. Also a couple indian restaurants are nearby. You can park in the nearby street parking here. There are also some cheap city parking spaces. 16th street mall is also located closed by to this place.
It's an amazing piece of art. Found out it costed $425,000 to put up. Oh,  he sure does love looking through them windows 😂😂😂

name: International Church of Cannabis
address: 400 S Logan St, Denver, CO 80209, USA
reviews: An awesome experience. Great hang out place. Chill hangout area with video games, snacks, and everything else. Very cool glad i came

Very fun! The guided meditation is worth it. The show is awesome. Love the game room and the free coffee before the show. The staff loves answering questions and there's some cool stuff in the gift shop

One of the most unique experiences in Denver! Make sure to come early and explore the lobby! Park on a side street or on the street parking on Logan.

The light show is a sensory symphony! Loved the music and visuals. I laid down in the pews and just existed. I recommend going with a group of friends or on your own. 

You cannot smoke in the facility during the light show.

i Love this place. very positive.message . self guided meditation . also fun . waiting room game area has lots of retro fun stuff. worthy cause ...not just about cannabis...that just heoghtens awareness not necessary tho

Walked in not knowing what to expect... One of the most beautiful things I've ever experienced. We arrived just in time for a show and it was amazing. Truly a magical worship experience full of music, colors, and some very inspiring words. Would absolutely recommend and I hope to see this expand into more places. 

"Even when we're busy, we can focus on what matters."

name: Four Mile Historic Park
address: 715 S Forest St, Denver, CO 80246, USA
reviews: When you are on a long bike ride, this is a great place to pull over and have a snack, beautiful and quiet. It's a great place with a covered pavilion and tables.
Awesome tour for those who would like see what life was like for a few in the 1840-60's, the tour guide was very informative and passionate and well dressed for the time period, great experience.

Getting the docent tour was definitely worth our wait. She shared a lot of great information about the property and those that lived here. If you don't have the opportunity for a docent lead tour of the main building you can catch some great information from the video playing in the visitors center. 

My 11yo enjoyed seeing a historical how. With all the details and mining for some gold.
Great stop when biking on the Cherry Creek trail. The quilts on display are beautiful. Friendly staff.
I'd like to visit it in spring or summer, it's a bit cold to explore everything in winter. Great locations of Wild West

name: ROOM 5280 - Denver Live Escape Games
reviews: Beyond amazing customer service. Price is totally worth it. So much fun. Extremely stimulating. Staff will not leave you hanging and they are very encouraging. Went once, loved it so much we came back the next day for the other room. We plan to visit the other location as well to complete the remaining rooms. Can't thank Room 5280 enough for being the start of our new addiction! Haha!

Staff are super friendly and the building was easy to find/clean. We did The Experiment room and it was definitely fun. The max was up to 6 people but there was not enough puzzles for 6 people to do. Definitely more of a 4-person room. That being said, it was also REALLY hard but we escaped with 8 minutes left! I'm hearing the Heist room is super good. Will definitely be back for that one!

Our host was cool and speedy, she had colored hair but I forgot her name :-(   Im from Los Angeles and have done close to 20 rooms.  The Weird Heritage room does not have a lot of production value but the puzzle were legit every step of the way. With out spoiling anything there was a perfect task that needed two people to work in unison testing the limits of their dexterity and calmness under pressure. Great room!
We had such a great time at this escape room! Guthrie was a great game master. He was super friendly and gave good clues and direction when we needed it. We will be back!
Kings hard to find, it blends with the houses around it. SO MUCH FUN!!! We made it out with 8 mins to spare!  Great group/ family activity!!

name: Denver Free Walking Tours
address: 200 E Colfax Ave, Denver, CO 80203, USA
reviews: First time visit was with the woman i adore and we had an amazing time. Beautiful views and all.

I enjoy taking walking tours for the cities I visit around the world so I thought I might as well take one in Denver, my hometown.  I wasn't disappointed and learned a few things I didn't know.

Note - Directions say to meet at the Capital steps but there are a lot of steps to chose from.  Specifically meet at the Civil War stature also known as the Chivington Statue or the Genocide Statue.

Loved our free walking tour! Alyce did an amazing job - she had so much cool information! She walked at a good pace, I never felt rushed. Wear tennis shoes and bring cash to tip your guide - definitely worth it! I feel like I got to see all the big things around downtown Denver after this tour, highly recommend!

We learnt so much about Denver with Cami as our excellent tour guide! It was a fabulous way to be introduced to Denver. We also signed up to the Greyline bus tour but we learnt so much more on this tour! Id recommend this to everyone!

EXCELLENT tour given by Alyce.  She was knowledgeable , informative and interesting.  She was happy to answer questions and was so warm and friendly.  The tour was great...I still can't believe it's free.  Highly, Highly recommend.

name: Tropical Discovery
reviews: Fun time. Good scenery for the animals
Amazing! Still here so I'll edit in a better review later!
Very cool! Lots of different reptiles and amphibians. They have a black room where you can view nocturnal animals
Fun for all ages.

Loved this zoo! I am from colorado springs and  have always gone to the chyenne moutain zoo, not bad, however I enjoyed the DZ much more. There were lots of awesome shows with helpful trainers who had no problem answering questions about the animals. They made the shows very fun while also remaining very informative. The trainers even reccomend apps that are informative and help us make mindful decisions considering endangered species. I would recommend this zoo for couples, old and young, as well as families, and field trips. 

Also this zoo has the largest bird exhibit I have ever seen. Super cool!

name: Lakeside Amusement Park
reviews: I love this place. Rides are fun and cheap. We always go for the Denver Film Society’s Summer Scream. Adults only. All you can ride. All you can drink. Be careful... that’s a dangerous combination.

Full of nostalgia, this is something worth experiencing at least once. It’s not super clean and the rides are old, but there was never a moment where anything felt unsafe. If you’re someone who loves typography, there are many old signs and plaques that are fun to see.

Come on an off day to beat the crowds and prepare to spend 2-3 hours here.

My grandfather used to run the pony track which has been gone for so many years ! My mom and uncle worked there when they were teens.   Fun house was my favorite and the train rides! I haven’t been there in years as live in Mississippi but lakeside has always been a part of me . I saw in the pictures the Whip may still be in action???  Ahh sweet memories !

Fun rides, and surprisingly decent food items to buy while there. The place looks kind of rundown, but it's still got its charm factor. During the week gets you a very nice all-inclusive price, and kids will like the kiddie rides. My favorite part is they allow you to bring in food and have covered picnic tables to use.
Love Lakeside! Fun rides, good food, never too long wait for rides. Great Family atmosphere.

name: Aspire Tours
address: 6275 W 38th Ave, Wheat Ridge, CO 80033, USA
reviews: I visited Denver for the weekend by myself and really wanted to check out the Rocky Mountains but I didn’t have a car nor the knowledge of where to even go in the mountains if I had a mode of transportation. I went on google and searched up “Rocky Mountain tours from Denver” and this listing came up. I was apprehensive at first but I read the reviews and it was all good feedback. I went on a Saturday and it was a breathtaking experience ... literally! My tour guide was Ryan (I forgot his last name but he has a PHD and grew up in the east coast) and he was amazing. We met at union station at 9am and we drove up in a big van with enough room for everybody and the whole ride up he provided great background and history.  He looked out for our safety by not letting us get too close to the animals that we saw throughout the day and made sure we got scenic views throughout the park. The food for lunch was great as well and it was able to keep me full for the remainder of the day. I was concerned about the trip being all day and whether I’d be able to handle it cause of the altitude but I was perfectly fine. I had a bottle of water with me the whole time which Ryan kept refilling for me and I wore comfortable clothing and shoes for the days adventure. I had a great experience and the price of the tour was justifiable. I would definitely recommend this as a must do for others visiting Denver!

Me and my wife went during the 1st week of march to the rocky mountain tour. Let me summarize my review at the onset: We had THE most iconic and memorable trip to the snowy mountains along with these guys. If you are in Denver/Boulder I would highly recommend you to take this trip. Our guide was perfectly on time at the pickup location and all along the way he took care of us and kept us entertained. He was the perfect travel companion and guide you could wish for; funny, informative and excellent knowledge of the region. The lunch sandwich+chips was good (they took our food allergies into account as well). There were multiple stops along the way to use to the washroom and stretch our legs. It was a particularly sunny day hence the views of the mountains were breathtaking providing multiple insta-opportunities. We heard many bear and moose stories and spotted a few dear. On our way back an entire herd of elk crossed the streets right in front of us!
A perfect 8.5 hrs trip from Denver.

Jennifer was our guide, we loved her.  She was very knowledgeable about the tour areas, very safe driver. Highly recommend this to see foothills without having to navigate& drive through yourself.  My family of 4 loved the sightseeing and small group tour setting.

If you’ve got an afternoon to spare and want to get a quick taste of the Boulder Flatirons (and Pearl St in Boulder proper), then the Boulder Hike and Beer four hour tour is the way to go! Jed was a fantastic guide, giving us enough historic facts about the area (as we drove from Denver to Boulder) to keep things interesting, but not so much that it was overwhelming. The hike is nice and moderate, giving you a good view of the mountains and surrounding plains — I especially enjoyed Jed teaching us about the useful (and not so useful!) plants we breed along the way. A beer in Boulder was a nice way to finish up the hot afternoon! 

A++ would Jed again.

Jeff our tour guide was the perfect Denver host. He was friendly and laid back and well informed.  About 2/3 into the day he mentioned he was actually a geologist which was super cool as he understood the geologic history of the region as well.  The van was comfy and he was easy to hear.  The coolest part was Jeff had an eagle eye for wildlife and we saw male and female elk groups and deer and a hawk. We stopped at a whiskey distillery to eat our box lunch. Box lunch was turkey sandwiches and chips from a local grocer. Make sure to wear shoes that you can walk on snow and ice and grab some gloves and hat. You head up to 9400+ feet and do a short hike to a cool lake and stunning view so this city girl was not as prepared as I should be.  Awesome tour and highly recommend it!

name: Mile High Wine Tours
reviews:
Outstanding guided tours both times we went. 

On one of our outings, When, after the first winery and lunch, cousins admitted beer was much more to their liking, guide switched gears and spent the remainder of the afternoon at craft breweries down town. 

Good deal with knowledgeable guide. Will do it again as a great way to introduce visitors to the mile high city.

Fun afternoon spent on the tour! Got to taste many wines over the 3 venues around Denver. Everything was taken care of including pickup and drop off in a nice Mercedes van. Also included a tour of the cellars/wine making process. There was also a lovely gourmet lunch at the first venue.

AMAZING! Cindi was the best host. She was fun, enthusiastic and really friendly. We did this wine tour with 12 girls for a bachelorette and we had the absolute best time. She was so accommodating to our needs.  Highly recommend this tour!!!

This tour was amazing! So well planned timing wise to let us spend enough time enjoying tasting at each of the wineries (we visited total of 3). We tasted about 30 different wines!!! and had an amazing lunch at Balistery Winery. Would definitely recommend Mile High Wine Tours and I will be back again!

This was my first visit to Denver and the wine tour was a great experience!! Cindy our guide was marvelous!! Her knowledge, her personality made the tour very enjoyable! I will tell all my family and friends about the wine tour and Cindy!!!

name: Rocky Mountain Balloon Rides
reviews: BREATHTAKING! This hot air balloon ride was such an amazing experience. Jeff was a great pilot with an immense amount of experience and knowledge. Jeff had coffee and breakfast snacks while setting up, which was such a sweet gesture. Also, he kindly let us sit in his car with the heat blasting so we wouldn't freeze while the balloon was blowing up. This was perfect for the cold morning and despite the cold weather, this ride was so worth it! What was great was that we had the basket all to ourselves since we were the only one signed up so private ride for a group rate, you cannot beat that!!!! The views are spectacular & that you can only get high up, so what better way! During the ride, Jeff educated on us on what he was doing and what gadgets he was working with. We landed safely and upon landing, Jeff brought out mimosas (or mimosas without OJ lol) and said the hot air balloon prayer. It was perfect way to end the whole thing and he even gave us suggestions for plans after since we were new to the area. Best way to start off the 2020 year!!

I had an awesome morning with Rocky Mountain Balloon rides. I was really nervous to do this but quickly felt comfortable and had a blast. Jeff has tons of experience and is a fun guy with great stories. We had a smooth take off and landing with about an hour flying in the air, close to 10 miles. Jeff’s your guy for an unforgettable experience!

This was an intimate and breathtaking experience that was well worth the money. Jeff was a fantastic and knowledgeable pilot who's 20 years of experience really showed through in his professionalism and piloting of the craft. Tom was also fantastic in making sure the details were attended to. They both has wonderful information and we knew we were in good hands with them. We will definitely be coming back for any future hot air balloon rides.

Jeff and his crew are awesome! He has been doing this for 20 years and is very knowledgeable of how to maneuver and deal with weather patterns. Amazing views of the Rockies and he made sure to slowly spin the balloon so we all had the same view. Safe landing and when we returned to the launch site they provided champagne and fresh fruit. Awesome time and highly recommend.

The ride piloted by Jeff Powell was truly remarkable. From the history he shared and the sites he pointed out, every minute was an experience. The rainbow balloon is a magnificent sight and the handling impeccable. 

Thank you for making our first anniversary -an unforgettable celebration!

name: The Money Museum at the Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City, Denver Branch
reviews:
Any museum about money is sure to delight, and this is no exception. It's small so you don't need more than an hour. Most of the historic artifacts on display are (unsurprisingly) old banknotes and coins, some dating from the colonial years of the country. The rest of the exhibits describe the history of the Federal Reserve, provide interesting tidbits about the money supply and the economy, and promote financial literacy and independence.

To get in, you need a state-issued ID or passport, and you go through an airport-style security check. Admission is free. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. There is no gift shop, but be sure to grab a free souvenir by the entrance, a small bag of shredded banknotes!

This place is so cool! It shows you how to detect counterfeit money by looking at it and even smelling it! Also you can see what $30,000,000 looks like! 
It is not a large museum, and it is free! You also get a little free bag of shredded money to take home with you! I wouldn’t recommend for kids under 5, just because they wouldn’t be able to really reach or understand the museum. 

Also you enter from the side of the building, google maps will take you to the front.
Nice for a little ten min stop, not much else. Also, I get money is around but security guard was really sketchy. If your that scared, don't people in?

This is the best quick museum for when you have 30 minutes to spare. The information is amazing. It is so cool to see how U.S. money has evolved. They have several interactive components and you can even take a picture with $30,00,000!

I wish there was more to see! We only had access to one main room and a projector tv room, it would be cool to have had tour of the whole building. Otherwise it was a very cool experience! They have high intense security but they are extremely friendly. Cool place to bring your kid. They have interactive activities and it was overall a decent experience. You learn a lot about money!

name: Epic Escape Game
address: 1750 N, Gilpin St, Denver, CO 80218, USA
reviews: Well, we lost but it was a lot of fun. The crew was really nice and this place is surprisingly spacious. I suppose I haven't really done any non trivial escape rooms. It's difficult to really go into details without spoilers. I would recommend about 5 people though and no more than that otherwise some of the rooms become too crowded.

I thoroughly enjoyed visiting this escape room facility! I am on a journey to visit escape rooms as I travel and this was the one I chose during my Colorado visit this week. Stephen was an excellent game master! The lore at the beginning was full of heart and the room was awesome with a nice medieval ambience track. The puzzles were nice as well. My pleasure to vindicate your room Stephen! Hope to visit again in the future, thank you.

Details:
Room - Excalibur
(Cloak is a must wear! Lol not really but enjoy the experience)

Had an amazing experience. I had messed up and booked a room at that Denver location by mistake. With that, when we showed up here they didn't have us on the books. J.J. went above and beyond and contacted the Denver location, transferred our booking to his location and got us in a room shortly after arrival. The room itself was a lot of fun, we had some first timers and they had a blast. The room we did was The Presidents Briefcase and it was challenging for the 6 of us. We finished with 5 minutes left. I totally recommend Epic Escape, stellar customer service and a great game. Worth it.
It was a good time. They had to stop the game to fix a couple errors but it was fine after that
By far the best! Challenging and fun. The hosts are always friendly and in theme!

name: Puzzah! Escape Room
