reviews: I went to Puzzah with a group of 6 people. The room we did was not as we expected. The puzzles had to be solve one by one to move on.  We thought we were able to solve other puzzles while another team member worked on one. It was frustrating to get stuck on one puzzle and not being able to move on. There was a point where all 5 of us were watching one team member solve a problem for over 6 mins and not being able to progress in the room. All the escape rooms we did in the past, this was beyond the least favorite of them. Hopefully they come up with creative ways to solve the puzzle rather than giving you the answers.
Loved it we will do one again.
Fun, puzzled based team work activity. You get about an hour to complete. The room was decent and the puzzles were mildly difficult even for kids. The house was friendly and the place was clean.
I am so incredibly sad that this location closed down, our family loved it. We will absolutely support the others.
This was so much fun! Definitely need to be in "thinking mode".... want to try more soon!!

name: Sculpture Park
reviews: This place was amazing, it was the first time we saw the tree light, and it was playing music, like it was a party. It was really fun and, exiting! I would recommend for anyone but there are a lot of flashing lights, and it doesn't stay all year, so keep that in mind.

Such a great little park, perfect for small breaks or if you just want to have some fresh air in the middle of Denver. This year (2019) the opened a new attraction for winter holidays, the Christmas tree! Definitely check it out if you are visiting, it won't disappoint you.
No goes there but to walk there dog around the sculpture. Also many outlets that no one can charge there phone. Good for the dogs...

The park is fine but the symphony at Boetcher Concert Hall is an experience a person should not miss. This was my first time there and I strongly recommend going at least once...it most likely will not be your last.
Went for the 35 got digital tree show synced with music. It was cool. The event was sponsored by Cherry Creek so they had giveaways and invited for friends for pics with Santa, etc.

name: Denver Skate Park
reviews: It was dope we got there early and started clearing the snow, next thing we know the whole skate park grabbed shovels and we cleared it as a community then we all shredded. The park is huge and there was so much to do there. Liked it alot.
It caters to begginers and those with more advance skill equally.   I wish this park was in NYC so I could use it all the time.

A great place to think & release the mind/soul. Practice the sport and network. It can be crowded with foreigners/visitors. Though always a fun/challenging time to skateboard with the locals. I constantly pick up trash there that people leave behind, would encourage to at least pick up after eating/drinking
Place is like a home away from home

Had fun. There was ice all in the bowls but when I go back it'll be gone. Wasn't crowded at noon on a Friday. The floor of the party is pretty nice, no one really got in my way. Will update when I go back.
Great park with a large street section, 3 bowls, and some other interesting terrain to roll on. Only down side was that it was pretty dusty when I was there making it a little slick. But great park.

name: Rocky Mountain Arsenal National Wildlife Refuge
address: 6550 Gateway Rd, Commerce City, CO 80022, USA
reviews: This is so much fun! It is a wonderful place to walk and hike. And, if you take the 11mile route around d the Arsena, you will see plenty of wildlife. The journey takes 45 minutes, but it took us 2 hours because of the amazing photo opportunities. This is worth a visit, and who can argue with Free? Thank you, Rocky Mountain Arsenal!l

Absolutely beautiful views and awesome experiences seeing the wildlife here 😍 I definitely recommend this place to visit regardless of the time of year. We visited in the winter and there were still plenty of animals out and about!! Take your time through the drive (the road is wide enough on the one way trail for other cars to go around you) so you don't miss anything. Also definitely stop by the visitor's center! The staff there gave us a run down on where we might see what animals and the most recent location where the Buffalo were seen.

Pretty cool place to drive through and check out some wildlife. They also have some nice walking trails and a cool visitors' center.  It's an easy spot to drive through on the way to the airport if you haven't seen any bison or deer during your visit to Denver.
Great facility! I've never seen so many bison and that close. They were right up next to the car. The prairie dogs were also very fun to watch. Park, bring a snack and get out of the city.

Really cool, wide open space with mountain views and high caliber wildlife. It's worth taking the nature drive (past the visitor center) to see herds of buffalo and deer. There are also lots of walking trails and some fishing spots. Great escape close to home!

name: Westlands Park
address: 5701 S Quebec St, Greenwood Village, CO 80111, USA
reviews: This park is still one of our favorite places to go.  Great places for the kids to play and explore, and great trails for walking.  We like to check out the ponds and trees for birds as well.

Beautiful. Varied paths. Lush greens. Public art. Large playgrounds. Multiple sports fields / courts. Bubbling water fountains for kids to play in. Large pond. Gorgeous trees. Spots for public events. A must see.

We Googled and found this nearby park since we are new to the neighborhood. It's great! The section with the instruments is the best I have seen compared to similar areas of other parks I've been to in three other states. My daughter also enjoyed chasing geese around. The playground has great equipment and there are paths for kids to ride their bikes.

Large and a very good place for kids to enjoy and play. Lots of slides and swings of different type. Many places to choose with good photo spots. One can come with family picnic, food and stuff. Beat thing is they have restrooms and drinking water. Small water pond also.

We visited this place for a short while yesterday. My daughter loved the play area. It was also a great place for walking. The field was huge and there were a lot of geese yesterday, which added to the beauty of the field, the park and the small pond nearby. There is also a watchtower from where you can get a better view of the surroundings. Overall, a very good place to spend 1-2 hours.

name: Museum of Outdoor Arts (MOA)
reviews: Very nice exhibits. Impressive amount of art in display. Staff very knowledgeable on the displays. They answered all my questions and explain more on detail each display. I recommend, if you are around the area, to stop by and check it out.
Great display. There's some really beautiful stuff in there. I interacted with 3 members of the staff and though they were not rude they weren't friendly at all. Still worth going.
This was a great morning. The RR exhibit and the levels of enthusiasm and knowledge of the staff was incredible.

This museum is geared more towards children. Took maybe 30 minutes to read everything thoroughly and decipher hidden messages. 
The installations were small, but I appreciated how different it was. It immersed you in an surrealist alternative reality.

Was denied entry. Told it was sold out, even though we drove over an hour from Greeley. My kids were disappointed as was my wife since I had talked it up beforehand. They needed a better system of communication. Maybe if you register they will tell you beforehand if it's sold out or warn you so you can buy tickets beforehand

name: Civic Center Park
reviews: Civic Center Park is actually a really nice place to hang out and chill. They often have rallies here that attract large crowds and the atmosphere is usually great but they do have a history of uncontrollable homelessness in which hundreds of homeless people come here to camp, use, and deal. This is definitely something people should know before bringing any young ones

Luckily I actually got to visit on a day that it wasn't snowing and it was very pleasant outside.  I have lived off and on In Denver since 2013 and ha e frequented the area in the past, but never took the time to take a walk through the park as the saying goes.  Very peaceful, very clean and educational!!  I will definitely visit it again!
Nice place. Recommend going during the day. There is a mixture of people in the area and there was a lot of litter on the day I went, but the area was still beautiful.

Excellent open area park in the heart of downtown. All the major buildings have numerous historical plaques and have stunning architecture. The promenade is a wonderful place to have a picnic or just take in the scenery. Photo ops abound. A must stop for visitors to the city.

Neat green space in the capitol area, surrounded by modern buildings and yes, the magnificent capitol with its eye catching dome. The place does have a sketchy feel with all the homeless and panhandlers roaming about, but they looked harmless and were not aggressive. When you see these people right where the seat of state government is, you're left wondering what those in power are doing to help them.

name: Pirates Cove Water Park
address: 1225 W Belleview Ave, Littleton, CO 80120, USA
reviews: A great, safe place to take little kids. I have a 5 and 2 year old that love the water. They have splash pads, and a large enough 3.5 ft pool area that the kids can enjoy. The larger slides and pools are in a separate area and so my littles aren't bothered that they are unable to play there. They have a Sandy Beach area to play in as well. I love that you can bring your own food in, too.  We will definitely be getting season passes each year!
Path Home Real Estate customer appreciation night with Frank's BBQ &. Pirates Cove pool party.  All the kids loved it and the adults ate it up.  Thanks Joe Bogar.
Best water park for littler kids (teens might be less entertained, but still plenty to do).
We arranged a birthday party for my 2yr old daughter here. She loved it as all other kids. parents enjoyed too. Very few -water slides but good enough for kids. Definitely recommend.

Always a fun time. The kids really enjoy this place. The staff is always friendly and the prices are low. My only complaint is that they could take better care of their restroom/changing rooms. I had the food for the first time and it wasn't half bad.

name: Cherry Creek State Park
address: 4201 S Parker Rd, Aurora, CO 80014, USA
reviews: This is a beautiful park. We stayed here for a week in November and had such a great experience. The laundry facility is very nice. The grounds are clean. The wild life is the best part though. We were washing laundry and my children rode their bikes back behind the building. My daughter came riding back to let me know there were deer near. They were right behind the building! We stood on the sidewalk and watched them stop along the walkway to eat and they ended up walking all the way down the walkway and right over to our RV spot. After that my kids decided to ride again and found the whole family of deer. We enjoyed our time here so much and would definitely recommend!

Massive area for so many activities. The off-leash park was INCREDIBLE. So much space, my dog definitely loves the entry ways for creek access. Really cool that the pass rolls into the next afternoon for up to 3 dogs.

I LOVE this park!  My friend had me meet her there the first time I went.  I was a little put off by the $10 admission PLUS a $3 fee to use the dog park.  But I was hooked after visiting!  There are two loops within the off leash dog area. One is about a mile and the other is about 2 miles.  It was super nice to be able to walk and not have my dogs leashed.  They romped and played, met new dogs and new people, and I could launch a ball as hard as I could without it going over a fence!  It was great!  I ended up buying a yearly pass which was $108.  I take the dogs 3-4 times a week and it's been wonderfu . Totally worth the money.

I think one of the best State parks around Denver. Remember the State Parks have hot showers. Great place to hike bike and have done plenty of orienteering courses at this park. Don't forget camping and grilling.
Great space, has a few agility obstacles strewn about. The dogs love the creek too and it's deep enough in places that they can swim a bit. The car line can be long though - usually around 30 minutes

name: Delicious Denver Food Tours
reviews: So much fun! We have done a few food tours in other cities and this one will definitely be one to remember. We did walk through some snow, but it wasn't unbearable. We learned so much about the city and Rob did a fantastic job answering our questions and taking care of us. Thank you Rob! This really made our trip special.

What an amazing experience! We had Chris as our tour guide and he was awesome. Funny, personable and knowledgeable. Jessica planed everything flawlessly even though our group had many food restrictions. I would definitely recommend the drink pairing as it really enhanced the experience. I am a Denver native and was surprised by how much I learned about the city on the tour. I highly recommend this tour if you are looking for a fun group event. We will be back!
Jill was amazing! We had a fabulous three hour tour with her all over lodo Denver. Our family loved her and all the food was perfect. From type to portion sizes. Absolutely fantastic.

The food tour was not only delicious but a lot of fun! It was very interesting to see local restaurants, hear about their history or specialties and have great food at each location. Highly recommend this tour!

The highlight of our time in Denver was our walking Food Tour.  The variety of tastings was perfect - loved the Navajo tacos, the REAL Italian pizza, butcher curated meats and cheeses and oh, those baked empanadas.  The drinks served with each were a great compliment - best margarita, housemade limoncello, old-fashioned with housemade bitters and finishing with a glass of Malbec.  The stories about each place were so interesting and Lisa was a really fun guide who managed to get a behind the scenes peak at the pizza kitchen.  We learned about this fun emerging neighborhood LODO and just had the perfect evening.

name: Denver Trolley
address: 1400 Water Street, Behind REI along the South Platte River., Visit our website for hours of operation., Denver, CO 80202, USA
reviews: The Denver Trolley is an under appreciated gem near REI and Starbucks. The gentlemen we had were polite, funny and respectful. The reversible seating once you hit the end of the line was awesome. If you wanna get to the children’s museum or even Denver Broncos home games, take this trolley.

I absolutely loved this little trolley experience. The ride isn't long but the workers have cheesy funny jokes and give lots of fun facts about Denver and the area surrounding the trolley ride. Kids will definitely enjoy this!
Great day had a lot of fun.  Enjoyed the ride.
Good overview of the scope of Denver. Super touristy. Lots of kids. This isn't necessarily must do but it's worth the ticket price and it's fun.

Fun for kids! 

Tip: go early; opens at 11am. Adults $5, kids under 4 free!

name: National Western Stock Show
reviews: The National Western Stock Show was awesome!! We got there right at 8am for the best parking... many of the exhibits don’t open until 9 bit there was SO MUCH TO SEE that really didn’t matter!! From the Children’s area that has the petting zoo (which we also got in line early for:)) to walking around and seeing SO MANY different animals...and BABY animals :)-it was PERFECT! There are shops galore and we went on the second to last day so were able to get some good deals on different items! If you haven’t gone, I would highly recommend it! Wear comfortable shoes for lots of walking and a bag to carry all your stuff in 😊... have a great time with your kids or on a date! Worth the time and money!!

I always go to the stock show every year with the family. We typically steer clear of the food stands because of prices but we enjoy walking around all the different vendors to see what cool things are being sold. We always would watch the rodeo because not only is it inexpensive but who wouldn't want to watch a clown jump in a barrel and get smashed by a bull? Can't wait for next years stock show when I have some land!

Get your cowboy on and come out to one of Denver's most iconic, annual events. You'll love the rodeo announcers banter as you're served up one bucking bronco after another twisting bull. There's tons of excitement to be had in that little stadium. Then, don't miss the hundreds of vendors throughout the complex. Some of this stuff you can only find at the Stock show.

Had a great time. Loved seeing all the animals. The babies are so cute. Watched the draft horse show. It was great. It was so funny watching the mules barrel race. I also enjoyed the beautiful prancing horses. The big strong horses doing the weight pulling was sure something to watch. They seem to love trying to pulled the heavy sleds. This is a great place to bring the entire family...young or old. Parking is free and they have free shuttles. Plan to spend the day.

Pretty cool place with different animals to look at and a great petting zoo! The arena is cool too and there are events that happen there off and on all day. The stock yard is great too and had buffalo, yaks, and even Texas Longhorns. Great educational experience for the whole family!

name: RiNo Art District
reviews: Great art , great bars and cafes, awesome people and a great night out district. You won’t find yourself at a loss with activity here. Good eats and nice cozy cafes to lose yourself in. The new RiNo district is definitely becoming more and more booming by the minute. And it’s also very accessible by public transit and the birds or limes scooters!!!

One of my favorite places in the Denver area. A lot of wall art building art, art and garages, on the ground.  You just never know what alley something beautiful might be worth the walk.  It’s such a fun cute place for people to express their creativity and their talent.

Fantastic restaurants, great shopping, and some super fun music.
Such a wonderful place to go visit. Quiet and lots to see. Really a great place to go if you're looking to see some amazing art.
Great area for a date night. Even better to grab a Lyft, Bird, or Lime scooter. Most of them are pretty low in battery in the evenings though. Lots of restaurants and bars in the area!
A beautiful walk to discover art and architecture. Easy to navigate the area on foot or public transportation.

name: Let's Roam
address: 1801 California St UNIT 2400, Denver, CO 80202, USA
reviews:
This is AMAZING!
I highly recommend it for all people of all ages who enjoy a good adventure and don't get bored easily. Awesome get-to-know-places kind of thing. Such a great idea whoever made this scavenger hunt, I say to you now and forever. With the full force of my team; you did a jolly good job, mate. Well done.
Love the holiday decor.  The cocktails were amazing, the atmosphere was wonderful and the food and service great.  Would totally go back when in the city again.

Nice way to see the city- lots of variety - coast, gardens, history, inner city. Brings you relatively back to the same spot. I am an android user and had no issues at all with the app. Paused it many times to explore areas further and eat lunch. Liked the questions at each point and the option to find places yourself or spend points for directions. Didn't like the photo challenges but they were easy enough to bypass.  Good length- took us most of the day. Will definitely be doing another one.

The lack of a proximity feature and distance/direction indicator proved to be frustrating. We relied on Google maps several times for guidance to the next location. Once at the locations the hunt was enjoyable and educational.  Three generations enjoyed our leisurely stroll through the campus of Arizona State University.

This was super fun. Such a great way to learn about the city. The kids loved it also. Easiest way to get them outside AND on their phone at the same time, not to mention the exercise that they got without realising it. Everyone who saw us doing the tour asked questions and helped us out, right down to opening the fire station for a quick free tour. We plan on doing this on every city that we can on our upcoming tour.  Recommended.

name: Great Lawn Park
reviews: Peaceful park to walk around. Pond and stream give it a peaceful atmosphere. Playground is great for kiddos.

It is a very great calm place for relaxing and great distension to let your kids enjoy the safe playground, but unfortunately, I noticed a tree trunk left after cutting a tree, which is frankly I consider it as a safety hazard. They can provide tripping hazards to children playing in the playground since they are solid wood, where if a person tumbling onto one can be seriously hurt. I am gonna attach photos for the park administration's reference for quick and early action.

It is a good park to have a good time with your children Ina clean, quiet, pretty and peaceful place, good lake with gooses, ducks and fishes. 
Plenty of space to walk and jogging.
Peaceful and beautiful lake. Awesome place to take dogs - both sidewalks and lush, green open space. Seated viewpoints. Highly recommended.
What a great park. Perfect for a walk. Woth or without a dog. Need a FREE DOG WALK? Download the Wag app and use code DEBRA1018.

name: Rockmount Ranch Wear Mfg Co
reviews:
Known for their iconic diamond shaped snap buttons, Rockmount has been a Denver landmark for generations...So much so that the city memorialized the late founder by giving that block of Wazee Street honorary signs renaming it Jack A. Weil Way. 

Rockmount is where you go to get something that will get you compliments every time you wear it. It's a preferred shopping stop by rock stars, rodeo champs, and anyone seeking high quality Western wear with distinctive flair. The space itself is store, warehouse and museum wrapped in one, and every time I've been in the staff treats me more like a neighbor than a customer. On multiple occasions, I've even had other loyal customers act as ambassadors, chatting me up and sharing about their "collection" of Rockmount.

The prices are on the higher end (expect to pay around $75-$110 for men's shirts) but the quality and style are worth it. My leather gloves are at least 6 years old and continue to look great. I still wear shirts I bought there 10+ years ago. I even have vintage 70s + 80s Rockmount shirts picked from thrift stores that have never so much as had a snap button fail.

If you're on a real spending spree, their hats, leather jackets, and cowboy/cowgirl boots are A+. If you'd like to get the experience but not the expense, t-shirts run about $25 and they have beautiful bandanas, stickers, and tin reproductions of their famous logo for under 10 bucks.

Fantastic store. Love the shirt I bought. Only low point was the staff shooing me away from new stock. I get it isn't for sale yet. I'm not local so encourage me to keep my eye on the website or give me the option to pre-order.

*There was a rack by the desks to the left behind the register. I was very interested in a shirt but was told it wasn't for sale yet. I will check out the website because it was an awesome shirt. I love the one I did buy and would buy another.

What a gem of a store! We visited for boots, and picked the store based purely off reviews and location. Little did we know, we walked right into a piece of the Western history. I've been enjoying reading Denver post articles about the history of this fantastic store and original owner. It's a family owned store with a variety of quality Western wear items from a variety of manufacturers. I now know their bread and butter is their line of high quality and I in Western shirts. They carry clothing apparel, jewelry and footwear for men, women and children. You'll be shocked at how much great stuff they pack inside this location. The store appears to be family operated, and the staff were about as kind as you could dream up. Apparel pricing is pretty great, including their still handmade in the USA Western shirts and high quality belts. We nabbed some boots for the kids, a gorgeous embroidered children's button up shirt (sadly, a gift), a book, and a beautiful tooled leather belt for me. They even let me swap the belt buckle with one I liked better.  

Tip: Don't forget to head upstairs and visit the little family curated, complete with personal items, anecdotes, and collectors memorabilia. And say "hi" to the Humboldt, the lovely yellow lab.
An excellent establishment for traditional western wear. Great atmosphere even if your just window shopping. Take a look at all the pictures,  some amazing history on those walls.

Coolest western clothing shop west of the Mississippi River. Uniquely designed shirts and large exotic boot selection. Family run store with a long history. Be somebody and be seen here. A destination onto its self.

name: Chamberlin Observatory
address: 2930 E Warren Ave, Denver, CO 80210, USA
reviews: Saturday night viewings & Tues/Thurs. public nights. If you are one that cares about the universe, space, astronomy, physics, or life in general, this is a great place to go. Whether visiting to view through a telescope, view the stars in a dimly lit area of the city, or just experience a peaceful ambiance, this is a must visit. The experience lends itself to all. People are friendly, observations are stunning, the experience is thought provoking. Thank you to Denver Astro Society for this! Much appreciation!
Took a tour of the Observatory and got to look at the moon through the telescope. It was an awesome experience. Even touring the basement. Highly recommend for everyone!!

The iced latte was nice but a bit watery. The ambiance was good, the internet was fast, but also it was hard to find chargers and the washroom was a bit dirty. Overall really nice atmosphere to study, the festive lights and music helped brighten the mood.

What a great Gem in Denver.
Beautiful when they have the open house nights
So fun to be able to go and peek through a giant telescope while getting schooled on  space by people who are passionate about it.

name: The Denver Central Market
reviews:
A great location to go if you're looking for food in the RiNo area. They have an amazing selection of local vendors and almost any time of food you could want. Also a good place to go if you're looking for a centralized location to meet friends and have a quick coffee or pastry.

It was difficult to find seating at peak hours but eventually we were able to find a table to fit our group. We were able to sit here for a few hours getting some meetings and work done without issue.

Super cool market! Sooo much going on. I was amazed at all the options. To name a few, ice cream shop as you walk in, bakery to the right, bar to the left, BBQ, vegetarian food outlet, oven baked pizzas(you can see them making your pizza!!) And chicken and burgers on the end. Lots of more things to do and see too! MUST go check this place out.

Such a cool location right in RiNo! The market place is huge with vaulted ceilings and a warm, industrial feel. There’s probably 10 different vendors in the space. Pizza, bbq, sandwiches, coffee, ice cream, pastries, etc. is all there. The Central Market is a wonderful place to hang out with friends or show visitors!
Fun atmosphere and vibe. Great location and great food options. It was hard to find a place to sit and I'd love to see the use of fewer to-go type containers.

Definitely gonna give five stars to this restaurant because their Meat items have impressed me a lot. There are various kinds of fast foods such as Chocolate cup cakes chicken, chicken and salad, etc. Very good customer service. Recommended to nearby people.

name: Rio Grande Mexican Restaurant
reviews: Very delicious chili con queso and tacos. Place was busy on a Wednesday evening after Rockies game, but server, Kati was efficient, friendly and helpful. She did say most items could be made gluten free and that they had a separate fryer for gf!

Quite the treat in LoDo Denver. Our server Andrew was really attentive and on his game. Each of us had different items and really enjoyed it. Definitely would recommend Rio Grande. If you come in, ask for Andrew.
Pretty good! The steak and chicken better than the fish I think! Quick and pretty good service

Went solo on a Monday at 6:30pm with beautiful 80 degree weather and sat outside. I was seated quickly at a 4 person table as the outside bar wasn't open yet. 

They have a relaxing fountain, although some modest music drowns it out a bit, and it's next to the street but the traffic is not loud or bothersome.

I met a cook that works there and asked him what he recommends and he said anything with steak. Ended up getting the steak fajitas with double rice, no beans, which was well portioned and had great sized veggies. Four flour tortillas came with it and were warm and soft. It was $22.63 with tax and I considered it well worth it!

The on-the-house salsa also had great spice to it and they offered to get me more, which not all places do, especially for one person.

Highly recommend this for a few friends getting together for a low key dinner or drinks.

I loved this place. They have quite a few vegetarian options and they are really good. They don't have any veggie taco options. But the way they make their black beans is amazing. I would recommend trying the house Margaritas (Mango - Strawberry is my favorite one). 
Recommend any vegetarian dishes to try. I tried a veggie burrito and a quesadilla.

name: Rioja
reviews: The food is exceptional, I believe this might be the best food I have ever tasted. The service was great as well, I am vegetarian and they made the tortellini vegetarian for me. Still so flavorful. I had a pear thyme soda, it was so delicious as well. They offer delicious bread to start with. Just a perfect experience for my 2 year anniversary with my boyfriend. I never can go to such fancy places, but this was well worth the price.

From start to finish this restaurant hit everything. Servers knew the menu and made excellent recommendations. (Thank you Jason!) Wine by the glass was nicely paired with interesting menu options. A wonderful meal overall. Stopped in for a weekend lunch recently and was very pleasantly surprised! I had been hoping for the standard lunch menu (which looked awesome) but was provided the brunch menu - which was terrific! Service was top notch. I would return here again without any hesitancy.

Great food! Amazing service.. the pasta were great and the vegetarian 4 platter was amazing! Really enjoyed dining at Rioja. Definitely on the expensive side but worth it. Also a good place for romantic dinner
Good service and good food. A few of the items I tried where worthy of high honors, but sadly A couple items where only normal quality. Still overall it was a good place for a special occasion
Rioja is always excellent! Service is the best you will get anywhere and food is always on point. One of the most consistent spots in Denver. Worth a visit or multiple!

name: El Five
address: 2930 Umatilla Fifth Floor, Denver, CO 80211, USA
reviews: I honestly did not know what to expect before coming to this restaurant and I would be lying if I said that I wasn’t a little bit nervous about going to it. But after my experience I realize that this place has so many amazing qualities to it that I will definitely be returning  within the nearby future! As soon as I walked in I felt very comfortable because of how clean the whole place was from the windows to the tables to the ground! I was immediately greeted by a very friendly staff member who walked me to the exact table that I actually wanted! My waiter was extremely superb and made sure that he got everything that I needed fast. Even though I only saw my waiter a couple times he was extremely kind and was willing to spark up a conversation which was very well mannered! That just shows me that this place only accepts top notch waiters to work there! There is also a very popular bar area inside of the restaurant that has any drink you could possibly ask for! The bartender is extremely helpful and will inform you on what exactly you are about to or currently are drinking. If you have not been to this restaurant yet and you live within the area, then you are highly missing out on the great food and customer service that they provide! Whether you live within the area or not if you truly want fresh quality food come give this restaurant a shot! The prices are also extremely fair considering you really get top notch food and customer service there, I have already recommended this place to multiple people and I will continue to do so due to the amazing experience that I received during my very first visit!

This is definitely one of the best restaurants in Denver. My friend and I weren't very excited when we read the menu online but everything was very well executed and delicious! We sat at the chefs table so we also enjoyed a few small samples. The sommelier was knowledgeable although we waited a while for her to show up. Their wine list has some less usual varietals. I had a white blend from Sicily and it was paired great with the sea bass dish. The view is a bonus.

I LIVE for this restaurant. Best service ever! Thanks Drew, Thanks Jack. WOW! The food is the best I have ever had & I travel the world as a foodie. Nothing beats El Five. You are not crowded in (Which is a deal breaker for me). Yes the views are the best in town but the food…Oh my God…the food will make you cry. Great different drinks. We took all of Jack’s suggestions & WOW did he ever hit the mark. See you soon.

Great view.  The mini lamb chops the best. It's I bit expensive but is worth it. They also valet which is convenience.  Clean full of beautiful people take  your  next date here and is a Done deal he/She will love it ❤❤❤

My wife and I had the pleasure of dining here while on a getaway weekend.  The food was amazing and beautifully presented; definitely recommed the smoked buffalo.  We were also lucky enough to arrive on a clear night and really enjoyed the view.  Our reservation was later in the evening, however at no point did that deter from the quality of service. Our server's recommendations were spot on for us. Overall a really memorable experience!!

name: Denver Biscuit Company
address: 3237 E Colfax Ave, Denver, CO 80206, USA
reviews: We got the Franklin it was really good! Hot chocolate was great. Big cinnamon roll biscuit was not good compared to regular cinnamon rolls. It seemed not cooked all the way through. Husband liked it, I'm picky about pastries. Got a side of scrambled eggs and they were perfectly cooked! I would definitely go back.

I was visiting from Texas and and we had a great meal! We loved that all the coffee cups were different and I happen to find a Texas one! Only downfall is they have all of these high tops, we really didn’t want to sit there but we had to if we wanted to eat. Great food but I would eliminate those tables!

Always a long wait but the food is incredible. The parking situation could be better but its usually worth it. The drinks are great and the service is usually pretty good. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants. I get the vegetarian biscuit pot pie, with a scrambled egg on top and it's always amazing 👌🏻
The food here is so delicious. I’ve only been here twice but the flavors are consistent. I definitely recommend The Franklin. It is very scrumptious!

It certainly lived up to the hype! The biscuits were gigantic, tender and fluffy! I could eat a bowl full of that sausage gravy though, so deliciously indulgent! And the chicken, while you can't see it, was spicy, smoky and deeply crunchy.

Definitely worth the stop if you're in Denver, CO

name: Fruition Restaurant
reviews: Absolutely amazing food and service.  This place has been on my bucket list for years and I am so happy I finally had the opportunity to visit.  The food and service were excellent.  Everything was above and beyond my expectations.  Thank you Fruition Team for doing what you do!  I hope to see you again soon!

What a wonderful experience! Went to celebrate my anniversary in memory of my husband with my son. They wrote a touching note thanking us. Food was fabulous and will definitely return. Thank you for a great night!

The short rib and jar o’ red velvet cake was spectacular. Thank you. Not sure what sort of magic Chef used to soften and cream the provolone, but wow. Marvelous as always. Thank you for working and continuing to feed your neighbors.

Fruition is always amazing but posting specifically about the takeout during Covid... absolutely incredible! Food is on point and delicious, packaging is well executed, call ahead process to grab a pickup slot is seamless, menu changes which is wonderful.. Thank you Fruition for making quarantine less terrible

Stellar restaurant. Top notch experience. 2 Michelin star level dining. And a 7 course tasting menu for under $100? An incredible value for such high level food. Service was easy and impeccable. I do a lot of Michelin level eating and this was one of the best. When I'm in Denver, I will return here for sure.

name: Barolo Grill
reviews: This is a high end, authentic, Italian Restaurant. The food is delicious and authentic Italian. When the Gnocchi is so flavorful that you want to lick the bowl; you know its great food. The pasta is hand made, the portions can be sized to smaller plates, a huge selection of wines. Very high end, environment was warm and cozy. Waiter was on point, informative and attentive.

We went here for our 18 year anniversary and had an incredible experience. Missy our server has been here for a few years and gave is an incredible experience.  Food was wonderful!! Manager (Adam) came out and said hello as well.

Wow, what an experience!! The atmosphere was lovely and lively, yet not overbearingly loud. Our waiter Seth truly did a wonderful job explaining everything and offering proper suggestions. To top it all off, the food was incredibly flavored and perfectly proportioned to your liking. It was the perfect place to celebrate a birthday or any special occasion.

This place is amazing. Time after time. By far the best Italian place in and around Denver.  My favorite restaurant hand down. The food is 5 star all the way. And Seth is the best server I have ever had. We only ask for him.

The food, staff, ambience, the food. The food. Did i mention how incredible the food is. I just did a 2 week trip in Italy eating pasta most if not each day. This was just as good. Wow. Stop reading this and just head over to Barolo Grill, you won't regret it. 
.
Aside: make a reservation. Also, the food seems pricey but on pasta you can do half orders. We did that so we could have a few different types of pastas. Yum!

name: Tavernetta
reviews: Actually came here for the 1st time yesterday. And we were so nicely surprised. Such an modern clean design of the interior. The staff is very kind and helpful. And food is amazing modern approach to my favorite classic Italian meals which I love when I am in Italy.

Tavernetta is where you go when your best friend is in town. Food A+, Wine A+, Service A+, Location A+. Eat something from every course. Pasta is magical. Meat perfectly seasoned. Beautiful ingredients, layers of flavors. Portions are just right. Impress your friends (or your date or your husband). Live your best life.

This restaurant is fabulous. The service from the moment you walk in is great. You are cared for by several staff members through your meal and they make sure you are taken care of well. The food was  fantastic and the portion sizes were perfect so we could try several dishes without getting too full too fast. Definitely will go back.

Absolutely amazing experience! Every dish was exceptional and the presentation was perfect! The staff is extremely helpful, hands down some of the best service I've encountered in a while! Keep up the great work, I recommend Tavernetta to anyone wanting a top notch experience!!

We stopped by for a Negroni for my birthday and stayed for a meat and cheese plate with dessert. Check out the community room it’s the best place to dine. You get a private window view of the kitchen.

name: Guard and Grace
reviews:
What an amazing experience. This place hits all the marks. The food, the drinks and the service are perfect. If your looking for a place to grab a perfectly cooked steak, or perhaps grab some oysters and crab legs, in downtown Denver, this is it. The wine selection has a wide range and there is something for everyone’s palette.  I highly recommend their version of surf and turf and check out their fresh bar of seafood. It has a fine dining/ classic American menu, with just enough unique flavors to appeal to pretty much anyone. 
We went here for an anniversary early dinner and it was perfect. Definitely make reservations because it books fast, even for lunch.

The food was great!  Everything came well-cooked and well-flavoured.  It should be the same with other upscale seafood restaurants.  But what sets this place above the others is the speed and the quality of the service!  Our server (sorry I did not get her name) worked wonders.  Her recommendations were sound, her appeal was above-board, her speed was unbelievable, and her Guard and Grace made the experience memorable!
Guard and Grace

Love Guard and Grace, but it has lost something over the years. I cannot place my finger on it. Overall, this is one of the best restaurants in Denver. You cannot go wrong with anything here. It can be a little pricey, but you would already know that if you were reviewing the menu.

If I could give more stars, I would. Everything about this place was amazing. The staff, the location, THE FOOD, and the ambience were all wonderful. We have the luxury of knowing Kyle Biddy in the kitchen. He was so knowledgeable about every dish and talked to us about everything on the menu. We got to try a lot of items on the menu and everything was delicious! (The Gnocchi, just WOW) The server was very attentive and knowledgeable as well. I would recommend this place if you are looking for a nice time out, great food and nice staff! On the pricey end, but well worth the money.

All the stars go to our server. Went here for a birthday celebration and Sarah made the experience unforgettable. I have never had such a great server- recommendations were on point, she was attentive but also not stiff. Thank you so much for making our dining experience amazing

name: Work & Class
reviews: Great place! Our table had a broad range of dietary restrictions including a vegetarian and a vegan but all of us left satisfied. This restaurant serves food primarily in the form of small plates. Many of the menu options were already vegan and several others were easily adapted to accommodate without sacrificing flavor. Everything was delicious, shareable, and beautifully plated. The view was also breathtaking from every table and the ambiance was perfect for dinner and drinks  with friends.Highly recommend

Denver tends to have a lot of the same options when it comes to bathrooms. The gentle, classy ambiance provided by Work & Class is not typical of what you find in the city, but a wonderful change of pace when looking to hide in the bathroom to get away from your sister while she vacations in the state of Colorado. I highly recommend spending some time enjoying the wonderful vibes provided in this grade A dump center.

I visited Work & Class for dinner while in town visiting a friend. I was intrigued by their approach to dining and the wonderful reviews for the food. 
I have to say I was not disappointed. The place was packed when we arrived on a Thursday night. Thankfully they were able to seat us. We got a table in the heated patio area which had a very appealing feel to it. 
Felicity was our server. She was enthusiastic and did a great job going over the menu and making recommendations. 
We ended up ordering a 1/4 lb of the lamb, the brisket and a 1/4 lemon brown butter chicken along with several sides. All proteins tasted amazing. The brisket serving seemed really small and wouldn’t have been enough on its own for one person. 
At the end of our meal we ordered some desserts to go. One of them being a hot brownie a la mode. They packed the brownie with the ice cream already on it which was a very poor choice and affected how we’d be able to enjoy the dessert later.

Just stopped by to get my first to-go food of the past few weeks, 1 meat and 1 veggie breakfast burrito. Both burritos were exceptional, these are new to my knowledge as a menu option. The mole sausage was fantastic, but the mushroom veggie version was my favorite. The mushroom was kinda like sausage, crumbly and savory. The gentleman that helped me out at the window shared the hospitality that work & class is known for. They had a jar of sanitized pens and gave my dog a treat. Great experience for my first meal 'out' in awhile, i'd recommend stopping by and supporting local, they are taking customer safety very seriously.

Amazing fun quirky place. Great location. We came here for a team dinner and although we had quite the wait. It was worth it. Went across the street to get drinks while we were waiting and had some here, no problem. Definitely get the mashed potatoes.

name: Panzano
reviews: We love going out. Yesterday we came to this magnificent restaurant which friends recommended to us. We passed a beautiful evening there with exceptional cooking and a well-trained team and a distinguished chief cook. We  added this venue in our phone list  and we shall definitely come back very soon.  Highly recommended.

Delicious food! Everything was very fresh and amazing! We definitely will be eating here again! Came here for our 10th anniversary meal and it definitely did NOT disappoint! Would love to try their breakfast and other entrees they serve as well!

Absolutely loved the bread basket with the paste to spread on it. It is absolutely delicious. The rest of the food was great as well. Almost wish they had a little bit of an easier menu but I guess it has a lot of traditional Italian foods. I wouldn't say that I'm the most pickiest eater but definitely a little bit more than most. I was able to find something that I would eat and it was actually quite delicious once I ate it. Highly recommend if you are a huge Italian foods person. Price wasn't terrible either. The food quality is worth every penny. The Waiting staff did great as well. Very prompt and helpful and was very good at explaining everything.
Delicious food & great staff!  Located inside the Hotel Monaco.  Reservstions are recommended.  Be sure to come with an appetite!

Came for restaurant week, will definitely be back to try their full menu. The food was amazing and the service was phenomenal! We were so full, we couldn't finish dessert but they boxed it up to take home and it was just as good the next day.

name: TAG Restaurant
reviews:
We went last night for Restaurant Week. The menu was OUTSTANDING, but what I want to highlight is the exceptional service we received. 
Our reservation was a bit delayed so the hostess had us wait at the bar and bought us a round of drinks. The bartenders took great care of us. The hostess kept us updated even though it was so busy. Once seated our waiter was just lovely. He seemed so relaxed even though they were busy. We had a great time and felt taken care of. It was so appreciated, beyond what the staff at TAG could possibly know. Thank you an out-of-this-world meal and a wonderful experience!
The food here was very inventive and interesting.  I really enjoyed exploring the chef's creations.
Great atmosphere and staff!!! The food is incredible! If you get the chance, sit at the bar facing the kitchen! Watching the cook's is so entertaining!!!

Couple of buddies and me went to the Motorcycle Show and after we went to TAG in Larimer Square. The experience was awesome some of the most tasteful food I’ve ever had. I had the Hamichi which was perfectly prepared love the Jalapeño and Pop Rocks touch. We had few other apps including the Kobe Sliders with fries. You’ve got to taste the fries! Epic French Fries. Dusted with cinnamon and sugar I think. Awesome taste. Our drinks were good the entrees were even better. One of us opted for the Hanger Steak - came out superb really flavorful and no over cooked. Try the sushi tacos another great dish. Over all we had a great experience and our food was epic. Gotta try this place.

If I could give this 10 stars I would. From the moment we walked in the door it was obvious the class and hospitality this place had. Our server Melissa was BEYOND. Even if the food was terrible, in which it was world class 5 star, I still would have given 5 stars based on Melissa’s service alone! The management was just sweeping the place, bussing tables, chatting with guests, picking up the slack like any amazing restaurant management would. The Director of Operations was in the house, what a guy, incredibly accommodating and clearly beyond passionate about the restaurant and the other restaurants owned, exactly why this restaurant is what it is. He was just magic, interacting with guests, his staff, ensuring nothing but the best for not only his guests but the people that worked for him. The food was ridiculously good, YOU MUST order the Kobe beef sliders, never had something like it in my life. Every dish was decadent, not a flavor missed. Tag Restaurant is a must when living or visiting the amazing city of Denver! Thank you to the Tag Restaurant team for an incredible night out.

name: Snooze an A.M. Eatery
reviews: This lovely joint is a can't miss! Do you enjoy eclectic food and drink with an appropriately bacon focused appreciation? Then this is the place for you. Great staff as well!! It does get busy, so prepare for some extra time. I highly suggest exploring their unique adult beverages. And boy oh boy, that Shrimp and Grits, tongue-boggling. Enjoy!!

Every dish was amazing I tried. Went on 4 different occasions. Atmosphere and music were nice. Pretty 'hip' place. To me the espresso flavour could use some loving. But small details especially for a diner 🤘

This restaurant always has a wait time, but at this location it is absolutely worth it. We went here for my 21st birthday and the staff was amazing. They made excellent recommendations and took all my allergies into consideration. Love this location, good job everyone!

As always I love coming here. I always joke with friends that paying $15 for pancakes is absurd but they make great food here. I have found myself hooked on the shrimp and grits of late and it has not disappointed one bit. The staff is welcoming both on your way in and on your way out -i think I was wished a great day by 7 or 8 people on the way out!

***this was for the Colorado Ave. location***
Just came for the first time ever. Quit my job and wanted to celebrate with a great brunch. The breakfast burrito was amazing. Even had hash browns in it. I got the spicy Bloody Mary and it wasn’t too spicy or too strong. The perfect balance. At the end, I told the waitress (who I’m sorry I forgot your name) that I was celebrating and she gave me props for living my best life. As I was leaving, she told me the manager has covered my meal and that they were happy I was doing this for myself. I talked to the manager, Noah, and said thank you. He even gave me a hug and said it was no problem and to keep “living my best life.” 100% will be returning.

name: Tables
reviews: On a recent visit to Denver our friends took us for dinner at Tables—it was an exceptional experience and delightful meal. Everything we had was so good, nobody wanted to share. Biggest standouts were the tuna tar tar, scallop risotto, and pork chop. Can’t say enough positive. Outstanding restaurant, totally worth a visit.

Tables is our Park Hill neighborhood special dining restaurant. With an eclectic atmosphere, the food is always excellently prepared, lots of it sourced locally with in-season freshness and the chef is creative in the presentation. You will be greeted warmly and have a great experience from the time of your booking until you have been served.

What an experience!  Once you're through the door and the curtain, you'll see why it's called Tables.
Excellent choice for either small business dinners or date night. Still casual enough that jeans aren't out of place. 
The food was simply amazing. Every detail was spot on. Presentation... Flavor... nothing was lacking.
Service was equally impressive. We were given plenty of time to select our meals and the waitstaff answered every question without a hint of condescension.
Probably not a great place for kids, though. So get a sitter and treat yourself!

We're from out of town; our relatives love this restaurant. Simple, inviting atmosphere - check. Gracious hosting - check. The FOOD! - Obviously crafted with an understanding of both  flavor reduction and simplicity that comes only from expertise and fresh components. The chef checked in us regularly.  Hope to be back soon!
Amazing service, lively but reasonably quiet atmosphere, well made, nicely presented and tasty food. Truly excellent.

name: Root Down
reviews: Everything we had--starters, main plates and desserts were amazing. They were super respectful of my mushroom allergy (even though it's not life-threatening) and even put the mushrooms in my husband's starter on the side so we could share (which was wonderful because his starter was delicious). My friend has an incredibly cheesy sense of humor and indulged in it a lot but our server was a great sport and very sweet.

THE Happy Hour to rule them all. Every drink was perfect, and service was phenomenal. There wasn't a single thing we didn't love. We ordered one of each for the apps and the arepa was my favourite by far, my boyfriend loved the beets salad with steak on it.
Terrific food, cocktails and ambiance. Trendy spot in a trendy neighborhood, every time I've been there the place has done a wonderful job. One of the more consistent restaurants in Denver!

Absolutely loved this place. Great atmosphere and the food was delicious. The menu was small but was eclectic and modern without being pretentious. The combination of different flavors in each dish was mouthwatering. I highly recommend.

It is pricey but wonderful!  I love what they are doing here.  I'm not a huge fan of going to the highlands, parking sucks and many other things but this place is delicious.  They also have a spot in the airport with we visit anytime we are there.

name: Acorn
reviews: I Spent a few weeks at the Four Seasons Hotel in downtown Denver experiencing all of the great dining experiences and adventures that the city had to offer.  I had heard about this restaurant but was a little hesitant to visit due to the mass amounts of other restaurants to visit. When I finally did give this place a shot, I was not disappointed at all coming here and I  was very surprised at just how well everything in the restaurant runs. As soon as you enter the restaurant you feel this atmosphere of class and chill vibes which is very relaxing, as well as just how clean and organized they keep the whole restaurant. All of the music playing around the restaurant was nice and at the perfect sound. There is an extremely large menu to choose from with lots of different options for different preferences in people’s taste. Overall the food is beyond spectacular and I would highly recommend visiting this restaurant if you live within the Denver area or just wish to dine some exquisite food! I have already recommended this restaurant to multiple amounts of my friends and family and the ones that have tried it have told me that they have had similar experiences to mine and just truly how amazing the service and food at this place is! The staff at this restaurant are also extremely friendly and will accommodate you with any needs you may have! This is some of the better food in Denver Colorado, and I would put it up there with other high class delicious restaurants within the area. As I said if you have not visited this place yet you are severely missing out and need to come on by and experience the greatness within this restaurant!

We hadn't been here in years, but it seems quality and above all service is still at a high level.  

We came here first when it was.newnajd the place to eat, but today we just came for some appetizers and drinks before a charity event. 

Bartender was knowledgeable and passionate about his whiskey and was able to assuage by curiosity about Japanese whiskeys.  

We enjoyed the cornbread appetizer and the sourdough appetizer and the green olives.

We came to Denver on our honeymoon, and explored many different restaurants during our stay. On our last night, on a whim, we came to Acorn, and experienced the best service and food of our trip! Our server Peter went above and beyond to make our dining experience special and unique! The food wasn’t what we expected at first, but with the first bite my new husband exclaimed that this was the best meal of the trip! If you come be sure to sit at one of Peter’s tables, and be prepared to enjoy a meal out of the ordinary; extraordinary!!!

Inspired dishes , wonderful service, top notch cocktails, and exquisite food. We went for lunch and were impressed. The music was just the right volume, the service was just the right level of attentiveness, and the food set the bar high. Acorn is what farm to table is supposed to be.

Some of the best food I have had in Denver! The waiter steered us in the right direction.. if you are in the mood for rich food, this is the place and the price matches it. Luckily it was worth every penny. In the photos you will see the tartar dish, the duck confit, and asparagus dish. Each one had incredible flavors and I’m not sure I would try anything else next time I go. When you find what you like, why change?

name: Sushi Den
address: 1487 S Pearl St, Denver, CO 80210, USA
reviews: You won’t be disappointed. Had a blast here with some friends. Service was fine not over the top not lacking anything. The menu was fantastic and the prices were fair. I would definitely go for sushi only or again for sushi and entrees. The calamari was the best I’ve had in the states. The waiters can really help you with decisions on unique dishes to try. Great service and the sushi is so fresh. Always want to visit Sushi Den when I go to Denver!

Fantastic sushi. And did not expect to have a sukiyaki available which was excellent. Basically a Japanese hot pot that I suggest everyone have once from anywhere worth getting it and it is certainly worth getting at sushi den. They also serve your choices in sequence of what should be eaten according to their taste profiles like what should be done; but is difficult based on the rate you eat and how much was ordered. Handled perfectly here

This was the best sushi we have had in the states. The rice was so wonderfully flavored and the balance between rice and fish was perfect to me. The fish was fresh tasting with a melt-in-your-mouth texture. They also use crisp veggies that added great contrast. The service was pleasant and helpful. Both the hostess and server offered great suggestions. We arrived on a Friday around 9pm and were seated and served promptly. Would highly recommend to anyone.

Incredible meal as usual, even during these times. You can see how hard the staff works inside from the street and it’s awesome to see a team coming together. Crispy spicy tuna, toro sashimi and a red dragon roll is the highlight of my week! Warm welcome from the patio, she even got me a water while I waited for the additions I made. I will absolutely do takeout again and be back when open to dine in. Wish we could do more than 18% tip!

Best sushi restaurant I've been to in my life. 
Everything from the miso soup, to the sushi rolls, and even seaweed salad was a cut above any I've had elsewhere!
Staff is courteous, professional, and service is all you'd expect and more at such a dining establishment.
The atmosphere is classy meets sultry. Bring a date, a colleague, or some friends. They'll thank you!

name: Watercourse Foods
reviews: One of the best restaurants in Denver. Vegan/vegetarian restaurant with plant based foods. Denver needs more restaurants like this that provide healthy, tasty, plant-based food. Thank you for creating a restaurant for vegans, vegetarians, plant-based eaters, health conscious consumers, and those looking to just eat really good food. Thank you! It is appreciated

This place is amazing. Coming from Boulder, I thought I we were pretty lucky to have the vegan options that we have, but this was a whole other level of amazing. I was completely blown away by Justin and Andrew’s service behind the bar, and coming from being a bartender for almost 10 years, I was so happy to see that there are people that not only work hard, but get to know their guests. Andrew was amazing to suggest things to do during our day in Denver and Justin shared travel experience ideas with us. Thank you so much for the great experience and having such great members on your staff! Great food and so many wonderful options!

Every vegan friend who's been to Denver told me to visit Watercourse Foods while here. They nailed it! Even my omnivore coworker absolutely flipped over the excellent food, drinks, staff and atmosphere here. He was even telling other folks about it the following day. It's truly that great. Not one single weakness here or at City O' City either (same owners, also top-notch in every way), just incredible vegan food done wonderfully well!
You guys made our day today. It’s been a crazy month and you proved food can make everything better.  Thank you very much.

First time we tried a Beet Latte and now we are hooked. A yummy healthy alternative for a drink to warm up a chilly evening. The beet latte also distracted us from the long wait (only downside) as this place was packed (and rightfully so).  The Beet Salad was scrumptious, we enjoyed every bite. But the showstopper for us was the Tamarind Street Noodle entree. We almost ordered a second plate just to take home for later. The Blueberry Chai Cheesecake ended on a nice note. Not too sweet and creamy even though 100% vegan. Love!

name: Mercantile Dining and Provision
reviews:
Popped in for a breakfast and coffee. My entire party was able to find seating (party of 7) and the counter service was simple to use.

The real star of the show is the owner (I think -- she might have also been the floor manager), but she made my morning. I ordered a sticky bun and it came to cold. She immediately noticed and told me to hold on. She returned shortly, asked me to close my eyes and breathe deeply. Suddenly, my senses were willed with warm caramel scent and I open my eyes to see my sticky bun warmed and waiting for me. 

What a great eye she had for customer satisfaction!  (I was going to eat it cold -- you can't keep me from pastries, but she made it an amazing experience)

My party had traditional breakfasts and everyone seemed to enjoy.

An amazing dining experience!

My brother (a local) recommended this spot noting that it had received the James Beard award in the previous year.

I was sold, but I wasn't sure how to dress  as I did not want to go out to a place that was too formal.

Mercantile is casual at the bar and closer to business attire at the tables.

The Menu did not disappoint as everything sounded great.  
I went with the duck:Tender with a perfect assortment of sauces and sides to accompany it.

The staff was friendly and it was enjoyable being able to watch the kitchen staff.

It is good enough for a special anniversary but priced to make it a weekly outing.

5 stars to this restaurant. I am looking forward to trying their partner restaurant

Fantastic! We went for lunch and will definitely be back for dinner. Even the gluten-free bread was excellent. The spare ribs was juicy and flavorful. We had 6 (and some very restrictive diets) and everyone was happy.  Love the bustle of having the market, cafe, and restaurant in one spot.

I enjoy service and I really like a restaurant the prides itself on providing the best. Mercantile numbers among the greats for this.
Attention to every detail. A complete immersion in a world where people care about your dining experience. It rarely gets better than this.
The food. I don't even know how to adequately compliment it. The foie dish I had was so good I wanted to cry.
I love their approach to modern American cuisine and their desire to provide it in the most creative way imaginable.
If you love good food accompanied by phenomenal service, you must try Mercantile.

This place is so good!! The service was amazing and the atmosphere was relaxing. Very easy to enjoy yourself at this restaurant - even as a single diner as I was this evening. Will definitely be coming back if I ever come back to Denver either on business or personal trip!

name: Table 6
reviews: This is a cozy yet spacious restaurant with a unique and a thoughtful menu.  The vegetables were in season and fresh, the bread with sea salt and pepper butter is delicious, and there were both meat and vegetarian dinner options.  I really like how customers can see the chefs working in the kitchen, and how our server took the time to explain the different menu items.  There is an expansive wine and beer list as well.  Overall, we enjoyed our meal very much!

This place is wonderful. Too many great things to say but the food is fabulous, they have an excellent wine selection, the atmosphere is cozy and inviting, and the service is great. Naomi did an awesome job and was very pleasant to dine with. Will certainly be coming back!

This was my first time trying this restaurant and I was referred there by one of it's chefs... I  thought that everything was great from the appetizer to the main entree and the wine pairing... Amazing experience...  (Mike was awsome...)

I have been coming here for many many years and seen changes which have never been bad. The food is always amazing and I love and hate the seasonal menus. All of the food is always amazing but savor it because you will more than likely never have it available again because of the menu changes, which isn't a bad thing :) Atmosphere is amazing especially when you can watch the chefs which is what this environment is. I'll keep going here for many more years to come!

We came for brunch. It was nothing short of amazing. First things first, Tommy (our server) was fantastic. The first thing he did after welcoming us was bring us 2 glasses of sparkling wine to wish us a happy anniversary. While we awaited our food he also brought us these amazing cookies (maybe almond). The food was also extremely good. We got to sit outside since the weather was gorgeous and sunny. The French toast, bacon, and eggs are notable from the menu and are delicious. We were also given this amazing peanut butter and chocolate dessert. The chocolate oozes out of these small dough balls dressed in powdered sugar with some kind of peanut butter garnish. It was awesome. Thanks Tommy.

name: Avelina
reviews: We went for restaurant week. Good food, boyfriend's pork was way salty unfortunately. Their flat iron ribeye was delicious. Old fashion was alright.  Nice atmosphere though!

We came for Sunday brunch in December and I was surprised how good the food was. The meals were substantial but very well balanced and delicious. We went for bottomless and they were very generous! The Bloody Mary bar was amazing! If you are looking for a good brunch place you have to try here!

After some reservation woes elsewhere we were able to find this Valentine's Day reservation only a week in advance. We're glad it happened the way it did, because it was perfect! The atmosphere is good, the service is good and the food was excellent. I was way overdue for perfectly cooked tuna, and the flavors in this dish were incredible. We also had Lamb shoulder and Osso Bucco and both were expertly done. Well be back, even if just to sit at the bar for some perfect drinks. Thanks!

Honestly a great meal. 

The pate could use seasoning and needs to cook slower to not be grainy. 

The anglotti were stellar

Was able to book the restaurant the same day for two of us and it was excellent! We started with both the meat and cheese platters and they were outstanding! Better than any place I have been to. They were large enough we regretted ordering dinner and the waiter was so kind and was able to cancel one of our orders and so we just shared our fish dish which was also delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant. The ambiance is also great.

name: Tacos Tequila Whiskey
reviews: Fire flames!! This place is legit, loves the atmosphere upstairs in the deck. Great place to hit before a Rockies game and walk or scooter over to the field. Check out happy hour! Great deals and food is even better. You won’t be let down. Recommend the hit salsa on the tacos and shots! Enjoy
Great little spot for drinks and tacos. Parking can be difficult because of the area so be mindful. They have a nice variety of taco flavors and even offer veggie options.

I really like it here. The staff is friendly, it feels cozy, the drinks are on point and the food is delicious. They have a lot of solid taco options, i have my favorites but i do try to order whatever special taco they have to branch out flavor wise. We love the salsas they have and we wish we could buy them by the bottle.

Absolutely delicious! Hongos (mushroom) tacos were surprisingly amazing! Lengua (cow tongue) tacos were simply mouth watering, along with everything else these two stars made this meal unforgettable. Definitely worth every bite, not to mention the drinks! Come thirsty, my friends.

This is my special occasion taco place, mainly because if wasn't "special occasion" I'd be there everyday. The staff is so energetic and funny, they really make you feel like your eating in their house. The tacos are out of this world dude. Love everything, cant wait till my next "special occasion" maybe I'll make up some holiday just to go back sooner!

name: Izakaya Den
address: 1487A S Pearl St, Denver, CO 80210, USA
reviews: This place is absolutely our favorite go to for sushi in Colorado.    The atmosphere and vibe is very hip and the food is always fresh and delicious.     The only thing that could make this better is if we lived closer so we could come more often.     The neighborhood is a gym and if you go early, you can spend some time walking around in some of the cute boutiques around the area.

I will absolutely come back here again. Just the architecture alone made the restaurant come alive. An open sushi table to watch the chefs create their masterpieces, a great selection of rare whiskeys, a saké selection of unmatched variety and quality, all perfect reasons to go. The entire restaurant transforms once you get to the upper level. So open!

Best sushi in Denver hands down! Incredible food and unparalleled service! The location is very nice and so warm and welcoming while broadcasting a fresh modern vibe. You want to impress your date? Take them here!

Excellent food. I love this place. Izakaya is better than many highly rated places I've tried in New York City, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Seattle and Vancouver. The freshest of ingredients expertly prepared. And the atmosphere of the restaurant is nice, especially sitting upstairs on a warm day with the roof opened up.

First time visit, and it was as perfect as I could have imagined. The quality of the sashimi is best I have experienced yet in Denver, and some of the best outside of Japan. The staff are very attentive, informative and polite. The interior of the building is beautiful and sets the perfect atmosphere for an Izakaya in the US. We will be certainly going back, and this has become on our list of must go hangouts.

name: Sam's No. 3
reviews:
I can't describe in words how amazing this place is. Before I get into other details, huge shout out to our server Tyson! He's an amazing server. Super friendly, very quick, and probably the best server I've had anywhere in the world I've been to. I hope his employers know how great he is!

Now for other details- we were supposed to be on a 25 minute wait, but we were seated much sooner than that. It was 2pm on a Thursday and I can see why there was a wait at such an odd time of day. The food is spectacular and the servings are huge. The mimosas have half a bottle of champagne in them! The green chili sauce on the breakfast burritos is to die for. The whole menu looked so good, so it was really hard to decide what to order. If we weren't traveling, I'd probably be a daily customer here. Do yourself a favor and check this place out.

This place is awesome. Servers are excellent. The food was great. Had the buffalo breakfast burrito. The breakfast burritos you can probably split between two people. Will definitely have to come back for lunch or dinner cause they’re menu has a lot of great options. Must stop!

I dropped into Sam’s hoping for a quick lunch and it was fantastic. Despite the lunch rush I was able to find an open spot at the counter and I was waited on right away. My 2 chili dogs were tasty and my fries crisp and hot. My drinks were refilled without having to ask for it which is always a plus when it comes to good service. I’d love to come back and try more of the many items in the menu.

The menu goes on forever here.   My group of five all had burgers and everyone was happy.  My California Burger was excellent and they weren't stingy with any of the toppings. I could only eat half my burger it was so large.  I can also recommend the onion rings.  Two of my colleagues had the Mac and cheese.  Both said it was super cheesey but lacked flavor.  Neither even ate half.  The vegetarian in the group liked the veggie burger with a lettuce wrap.  Happy dining!

Nice spot with friendly staff. Prompt service, both the server and food. I had the fried chicken breast sandwich with mashed potatoes while the wife had the All American cheeseburger and fries; both were tasty. Comprehensive menu where you'll likely find something you're in the mood for. Would definitely recommend.

name: Tocabe, An American Indian Eatery
reviews: First time eating here and it was delicious!  My lunch companion is a carnivore and I'm a vegetarian, yet there were plentiful options for both of us. (It's very vegan friendly too.) My friend got the fry bread plate and absolutely loved it. He felt the portion was kind of small for the money, but loved the taste and flavors. I got the bowl and found my portion size much better.  We both agree this is definitely a place we'll return regularly!

The food here is absolutely fantastic to say the least! This place is a local place that serves mouth watering authentic foreign food that everyone in Denver Colorado needs to immediately try! There are so many options on the menu to choose from that you never truly run out of options, not to mention all the food is always fresh and unique (in a great way). The interior of the place is also very clean as well as neatly organized by the staff there, it made it much more comfortable to be inside of compared to other places that don’t keep it clean and ruin the dining experience! Prices are amazing considering the quality of the food is much better compared to other places within the local area! The location of this place is also really simple to find and there are always places to find a parking spot nearby which is very nice! The service from the staff is also far better than most places within the city, they are very kind and friendly and will help you make sure that you order something that you will like to eat. Overall I would not only give the food a 10/10 but I would give the inside, the staff, and everything else inside of the store a 10/10, if you have not been here already and live within the nearby area I highly recommend stopping by and trying out their delicious food you will not regret it! I will most certainly be recommending this place to all of my friends and family so they can have a fine dining experience as well!

This was delicious. We arrived just before the lunch rush and got to deliberate a little over what to get. We ended up with a Indian Taco and Vegetarian bowl. I loved that I could custom add the ingredients and everything tasted great. 

It's an order at the counter spot and find your seat from the available ones. It was clean and had an overall chill vibe.

This was our first time here and we will be back. The staff was good about explaining things and we had great Indian tacos. I had a ground Bison taco. It had black beans, squash, lettuce, cheese and sour cream. I think I’m forgetting something but it was so tasty with so many flavors and textures. There are many different combinations that are possible. Yummy!

Growing up in Texas and having a long history of smoking meats I was thrilled to see bison ribs on the menu.  The rub and smoke was perfect and the portions were very generous! The elderberry dressing on my salad was unique and perfectly balanced.  Wash your hands, put aside your fears and go try this amazingly worthwhile place!

name: Beast + Bottle
reviews: This place is very good both in food and atmosphere.  They have a very good lamb pasta which has almost stew like qualities.  The wine recommended pair well.  Staff were friendly and this place has a nice neighborhood atmosphere.  The desserts were also worth a taste or two.  It’s worth a visit.

Experienced for the first time during restaurant week. They have a curious and experimental kitchen staff who create a large variety of both vegetarian and meat plates. Staff was friendly and attentive. Quaint atmosphere perfect for date night.

I've always enjoyed this venue. It's cozy, romantic, elegant and quaint. The idea of utilizing everything in their butchering of an animal really appeals to me. The whole conscientious philosophy is so appreciated.
Great food, service and an educated approach wins me over!

The food was really good. The Brown Betty waffle is just as good as everyone says. We were asked to move from our table to the bar because the next reservation was there. We still had drinks and coffee and hadn’t been there that long. It was a first. But they gave us a drink. Bartender was super friendly.

Excellent food drinks and service.  Brunch was great and relaxing.  Breakfast sandwich on a homemade biscuit, Cacio E Pepe omelette...really good....sticky bun a must try.  Dimmi Shelter excellent drink. Friendly and attentive service. Will visit again when in Denver.

name: Snooze an A.M. Eatery
reviews: I have always wanted to eat here, but the wait is always so long, I have always avoided it. On this day, we were dropping off family early at Union Station, so it worked out well for us to give it a try. I would describe the food as breakfast food to indulge on. You won't get plain pancakes or muffins here, but it's a wonderful place to eat at every now and again. They have lots of options of eggs and pancakes, and they even have boozy coffee and breakfast drinks. I enjoyed the cherries jubilee pancake, which was delicious.
