It wasn't even as sweet as I expected it to be, so it was perfect for me. Others in our party had egg plates, porridge, and French toast, which they all said they enjoyed. The staff was friendly and helpful too. I wouldn't come here to eat all the time, but it's definitely a fun place to go on occasion.

The food and service was phenomenal. Definitely call ahead to get a place in line during the mornings because it can be up to an hour wait to get a table. We called ahead and they got us a table within 20 minutes after arriving. Their servers are very polite and prompt and even on a busy day, they got the food out to us in about 15 minutes. Snooze for sure needs to be on your brunch list!

Without doubt, the best-tasting healthy meal ever! You are likely to encounter a wait when you get there; it's worth it! And DO listen to the recommendations of the wait staff (you'll still be able to customize things your way). Free coffee helps the wait go by faster. I want to go back already!

Very good food their drinks are amazing. We had great service. this location is very busy you can expect a wait on the weekends. But Union station is nice to walk around and tattered cover is right across the hallway from the restaurant. they send you a text message when your table is ready so you can go exploring while you wait which is a very nice option. I highly recommend this restaurant.

The pancake flight!  Perfect option for people like me who can't decide on which pancake to try.  (Hint: they're all great!)

This is my first time visiting the city.  There was a small, but reasonable wait.  (And it was worth it.)  The service was great, and so was the food.

name: EDGE Restaurant & Bar
reviews: I went here on my anniversary with my boyfriend. The service is amazing, I really like the waiter. He was very professional, funny, and knowledgeable on what alcohol I should get, since I don't drink alcohol often. The plating is very minimalist and clean (the filet mignon), but the flavor is bland for my dish (salmon with curry). When we paid our bill, the waiter gave us chocolate cows for free. That really made our night!  Overall, I really like the service and the atmosphere, but the flavor of the food could be improve.

Stayed in the 4 seasons for Valentine’s Day, wanted to make the night easy so we made reservations at edge because it was in the hotel. Everything was great! Our waiter was great, friendly but not too friendly, he recommended things purposefully and actually listened to our questions. All and all a great night!

Scott was an amazing server. We arrived after a 7 hour drive and chose Edge for the bison burger. When we arrived, we discovered that they were only serving brunch and that the bison burger wasn't on the menu. Scott offered to ask the chef did he could make it anyway and the chef agreed!!!!! It was DELICIOUS. My husband said he'd drive to Denver just for this burger. I can't thank Scott enough for being so accommodating. He even recommended other adventures for us :)

We had just arrived in Denver late. We were tired and hungry so we opted to stay in the hotel and dine at Edge. It was perfect! We both agreed that this place was great. We loved the restaurant decor. The service was wonderful and the meal was great! We would definitely recommend this restaurant in every way!

Great food and atmosphere.  Appetizers were unique - the hot stone where you cook a small steak wasunique and delicious.  Staff was top notch.  Great dessert - whiskey flavored ice cream.  4 seasons is a beautiful setting.  Great spot to dine downtown.

name: Hop Alley
reviews:
My man and I came here for our early "service industry" Valentine's day since we'd be working all weekend. 

This restaurant was his old stomping ground, so he guided me through the menu with ease and confidence, and put a beautiful meal in front of us. 

We had duck rolls, the whole fish, the cold tofu dish, and about 4 cocktails and some wine. 

Everything was perfect. The lady bartenders were absolutely on point, friendly and knowledgeable. Loved them.

Overall, a small, cozy restaurant that might be on a small wait, but is worth it. Glad to have checked this place off my list ✔️

Very hip and friendly atmosphere and the food execution was 5/5!  The dumplings were perfection, spicy but as good as it gets.  I don’t usually go for tofu but I would get that every time I visit, excellent sauce.  

If you can’t handle spicy, this isn’t the place for you (I’m sure you can find something on the menu though, it’s all good).

Went right when they opened and there was a long line out the door. A few folks before us were told that the next available table would be around 9pm, so we were fully prepared to go somewhere else. Luckily, we were a party of 3, and they had space to seat us immediately at the end of a communal table!

We ordered a bunch of dishes, and while everything was tasty, nothing really jumped out as super interesting or unique. Overall, I think it's a decent upscale restaurant with good Chinese food, but I personally don't think it's necessarily worth the price or the hype. I would definitely recommend getting a reservation if you want to try it out though!

My friends and I ordered takeout for a celebratory dinner. The food was ready fast and pickup was easy! They brought the food out to the car so it was super simple. The food was hot even after we got home, 20 min. The duck rolls were amazing! The La Zi Ja is also a must have. I will totally be going back!

I had a terrific meal with friends here last night. The food and service exceeded all expectations. I like to ask my servers for suggestions, and Risa offered several great options. I recommend the duck, grilled octopus, and tomahawk steak. Their cocktails were also magnificent. Risa and Samantha provided outstanding service. Thank you to both of you!

name: Bar Dough
reviews: Get a pizza. Just do it. Some of the best pizza in Denver. Their pasta is incredible too. Service here is unparalleled as well. The attention to detail deserves notice from all other nearby restaurants.

Arrived solo around 6:15 pm on a sunny Monday evening and sat at the bar. The place was lively, with an active dinner crowd of large groups (6+), friends and what looked like colleagues.

I ordered a Tuscan wine ($18, 9 ounces) and one of their pizzas with sausage ($17). The wine was a hit, definitely a bit upscale and just right. The pizza was par for course as well, well balanced and appropriate against expectations.

Service was good, attentive while multitasking vigorously. They had some odd black and white cartoon dog series on TV, where they were playing soccer and driving. The wine definitely helped make that more interesting than odd.

The counter tops at the bar were nice, and there was plenty of space and options for an even larger crowd. The outdoor patio was nice as well, more suitable for groups of 3 or 4.

I would recommend this place for medium-sized groups, informal business meals and friends looking for a lively environment.

Cute spot for brunch. Excellent service and tasty food. The bacon was delicious and quite possibly my favorite bite of food of the day. The fried chicken was good. And of course we had to try a fancy toast. I enjoyed my aperol spritz as it was a perfect compliment to my brunch.
Fantastic place! Great to take your friends or family members. The staff are humble and attentive that make you feel like a king. I recommend sitting at the chefs table to get a dinner and a show.
The pizza was phenomenal. Got gluten free crust with no sausage and beyond good. Breast pizza in Denver

name: Buckhorn Exchange Restaurant
reviews: Been a few times, and it's amazing every time!! The wild game they serve is divine, and the staff really seems to care about providing the best experience possible. One time, my ex and I ended up there after getting on the wrong light rail train after a Broncos game, and hung out there for a few drinks and an appetizer. The bartender was super friendly and fun, and gave us plenty of attention even though it was pretty busy as always! If you have guests coming from out of town and have a little money to spare, I highly recommend taking them to the Buckhorn Exchange for a truly unique experience.

Buckhorn Exchange is the optimal place to eat a lot of different types of game meat, including elk and rattlesnake. However, their signature dish has to be the Rocky Mountain Oysters which aren't that amazing to be honest. The portion sizes for them are fair but they don't taste too good. Service, however, was fast and very friendly. The interior decor was also really nice, and this is a good place for exotic meat lovers.

Yes, its pricey but you're paying for the experience as well as the food.  We brought visitors from Spain and they were delighted.  We started with the rattlesnake queso which was pretty good.   I had the elk and it was delicious.  They ate bison prime rib and elk and were pleased. 
The place itself is very entertaining.  Quite unique.
We had a very good experience service wise.
Again, it is not cheap to eat here and it is not the best cuisine I have ever experienced but it was a very fun night.  The Spaniards will have a good story to tell when they go home.

My family and I came in from San Antonio and heard about this place...it was definitely an experience. We arrived and was told the wait was an hour long... I wasn't sure how the night would turn out after that... It was amazing! We waited upstairs in the bar area where our kids circled the back room.. The delightful bar service made our wait seem like minutes instead of hours. It was an enjoyable meal as well. Waitress was amazing as well. There is definitely a reason why they are still open after so long. Coming back here for sure!

Absolutely delicious food and outstanding service.  I knew I wanted to try the buffalo and the quail and they put together a combination plate for me. Prices are reasonable.  I highly recommend this restaurant.  So good!

name: Hops & Pie/Berkeley Donuts
reviews:
Wow! This place is a gem! Amazing tasting pizza. Cold beer on tap. A wide selection of their menu of both food and drinks. 

We went as a party of four and waited about 30 minutes. It was well worth the wait. The restaurant is tiny, so expect longer waits when they are busy. 

I saw they had Rafe beer on the menu. I finally got to try Pliny the Elder. I'm not a fan of IPA's, but it was paletteable. 

Service was great. 

I will be back

Everyone is so nice here and they made our family’s day!  I went in for donuts on Sunday morning with my three kids (ages 3,5,&8). Needless to say we were slow to get out of the house and were a little late for the donut crowd. Although they were sold out the staff was able to find a donut for our crew to share. It was a small gesture that made us feel so special. Thank you hops & pie!

Service was stellar. Beer selection is great. The thin crust was crispy and buttery. The house pesto was awesome on the slice of the day! The only thing that didn't make it a 5 star pizza joint was the pepperoni. We agreed they are equivalent to the pepperonis found on frozen Red Baron!!

Ordered pizza and salad. Have been to restaurant multiple times and it was great. However when we tried to order it was disastrous. Good thing we had some cans of tuna. This  place is great for eat in but blows for delivery. 3 hours later and STILL waiting for food.
Good customer service,  busy ambience! Unique beers, pizza crust was fresh and crispy all though I was expecting more smoke flavor on my brisket and chicken.

name: Bastien's Restaurant
address: 3503 E Colfax Ave, Denver, CO 80206, USA
reviews:
Steaks, salads and desserts were delicious! Drinks were good. We had 8 at our table for a bday party (cheese cake with a candle was nice surprise).  Service was good until the check came. Then no one returned to take our money for 20-25 minutes. When the manager finally came and cashed us out, she was pushy to get us out.  Not our fault your person didn't pick up the credit card (1), it was ready immediately after bringing the bill.
Overall,  good experience.

We love this place. Old school cool all the way, from the building itself, to the professional yet courteous service. And the food. The sugar steak is a marvel, a charred exterior with just enough spice to accent the meat. The edible flowers on the plate take me back to the 80s, unfortunately, so do the steam table veggies, a real afterthought, but that's not why you go there. Last time had a couple minor problems, my steak was just barely over done, and everything needed a hint of salt. But trust me, we'll be back.

Great steak place!!!! I visited on vacation and saw this restaurant came up highly recommend on Google Maps and I see why! Very high quality meal and not super expensive. If I’m back in Denver I’ll definitely visit again.

The service and the food were just wonderful.   Bastions is kind of a classic standard place because it's so popular,  but it's anything but run of the mill.  Very high degree of personal attention and service.  The desserts we had were absolutely off the charts.  I had the sizzling apple pie with ice cream and it was worth the price of the extra calories,  lol!  If you're on this part of Colfax,  and want a truly delightful time with friends and great food, DO NOT MISS THIS PLACE!

Went to this restaurant for first time on Valentine's Day.  It was delicious.  I was surprised they don't offer a baked potato as a side dish option.  Only two kinds of mashed potatoes.  They were delicious, but I am a steak, baked potato and side salad kind of girl.  I don't remember them offering any kind of steak sauce.  The steak was delicious.  We sat upstairs.  I remember the hostess was kind of trying to talk us out of going upstairs, saying there was no restroom and all you can see is the bottom floor. I found sitting upstairs nice.  It's a smaller venue, cozy.  Our waitress was really nice and kept our drinks filled.  The menu is a little on the spendy side.  There is plenty of parking in the back. Would recommend reservations.  As far as supporting local family owned restaurants, this place is a nice for a good steak.

name: Safta Restaurant
reviews: Was sat at the bar due to no reservation. Sexton was our amazing bartender/server. Offered some of his favorite items and they were great. Overall great first experience, would definitely recommend, definitely worth the try if you're looking for something out of your comfort zone. Spread for 2(my wife and I). I can eat and I got stuffed. Can't wait to try some of the other dishes.

Excellent food! Went here for my birthday dinner last night. My friends and I were really impressed by the food and the service. You HAVE to get the hummus. They give you unlimited pita bread too. The waitress even gave me some to go!! They also confirmed my reservation several times (phone and text messages), which was encouraging with everything going on these days. I’m definitely going back!!

This is by far one of my favorite restaurants in Denver right now.
Delicious drinks, nice ambiance, great friendly staff and the food! Oh my God the food... Literally everything on the menu is amazing, I will find myself daydreaming about it. The fresh pita that they just keep coming is delicious, plenty of vegetarian options. Every person I bring here is blown away.

Fantastic sharing restaurant! We stuck to hummus, mini, and small plates. Everything was on point. The eggplant was my favorite. The drinks were tasty and the service was good. It was a lovely atmosphere. Definitely a bit pricy, but perfect for a double date or small group.

Five star restaurant! Amazing food and drinks. Set in a fun atmosphere, you can walk around to shop or look at some art while you wait. The mushroom hummus is the best hummus I have ever had. A little steep in prices, but having lots of small plates to eat from fill you up quickly. The waitress was kind enough to mark up a menu to indicate all the vegan options. Bonus points for the killer mint tea!

name: ChoLon
reviews: Definitely good food. I highly recommend going there. The food comes out like family style and it's definitely big enough to share. Duncan, our waiter, was fantastic. He shared his recommendations which we personally took in consideration and everything came out absolutely delicious and in a timely manner. They can make things vegetarian as long as you ask. The service here is phenomenal; everyone is very attentive so you're never sitting there with dirty plates or empty dishes. It's the simple things and details that I really appreciated. As far as the dishes go, here's what I recommend: everything. But seriously if I had to pick, the Kaya toast is fantastic as well as the Malaysian noodles.

Delicious for lunch and dinner. The soup dumplings are perfect, Brussels are perfectly cooked and the kefir leaves add a great lemony flavor. Enjoy our meals each time. Definitely recommend sitting at the chef's counter.

We went on a Thursday evening at dinner time and had no issues with getting a table. I called and they said no dress code and no reservations required. I was visiting Denver and had heard amazing things about the food here so I took my friends here to celebrate / close out my week of visiting with them. So glad we did because it is rare that I've been so blown away by unique but so flavorful dishes!! And the presentation!! My favorites were the soup dumplings, the toast (I was NOT expecting to like the toast but the coconut wasn't overpowering at all and it was freaking amazing, get it) and the handmade noodle wok dish. The toast came in big chunks that you then dip into a sauce (go all the way to the bottom w/dip), see pic. Then also the lamb dish and sushi..  you know what, all of it was simply phenomenal. Great attentive waitstaff too. I also love how you order it as a table, and share. It was the perfect special meal. Definitely a must in downtown Denver.

A five-star Gem of a restaurant. We receive excellent service from waiter Jennifer. The food was amazing. You definitely want to buy and try the items on the menu that are suggested by the waitstaff. We enjoyed the dumplings the week of beef the lobster crate in the bone marrow rice cake Korean style stir fry. I think this restaurant Rivals and is better than many of the restaurants I've been to in Washington DC. If you are in Denver living there or visiting this is a must do restaurant.

Very good restaurant. Food was fresh and amazing taste. Definitely give this place a try if you are in the area.

Update: came back for the dinner menu... Amazing.

name: Señor Bear
reviews: Came for brunch had the queso to start, by far the best I've ever had! We all tried different brunch entrees and everyone had a unique taste and flavor that was unmatched by any other Latin infused cuisine. Will definitely be coming back for more!

One our favorite spots in Denver. Been twice with my wife for her birthday. Amazing service and the food is top notch.  I highly recommend ordering the picnic basket.  Definitely worth the price. We'll definitely be back again.

Everything was five stars. Had a four course meal and it was just an awesome place.  We've had more expensive meals that were not nearly as good.  The creativity, portions, service all five stars.  Looking forward to coming back more regularly for happy hour.

Trendy restaurant with Latin American fusion cuisine. Very tasty and rather small plates encourage to order more meals. Menu has just been changed to Spring - Summer much lighter. 
Pretty busy, earlier booking recommended.

Came here for dinner and fell in love. Served family-style, It's nice for a group of four to be able to order multiple things and try the menu. The cocktails are creative and really good. The Latin/Argentinian menu is delicious, and the staff was very friendly during our visit. The place isn't too terribly big, so on busy times, it might make sense to make a reservation. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone in the area.

name: El Taco De Mexico
address: 714 Santa Fe Dr, Denver, CO 80204, USA
reviews: Authentic Mexican.  We came at noon on a Saturday and the line went out the door but there were two people taking orders to it didn't take long to receive our food. Definitely coming back!!

This place. Let me tell you about this place.... run by the most wonderful women you can imagine that know their stuff. It is mesmerizing to sit at the counter to eat and watch these women make the food. They truly know what they are doing and this place is so good!! It gets pretty busy so the sooner the better. There is not bad option to choose unless you have food allergies and if that is the case just fill up on the beans, those are great as well.

My hopes were high. I felt a little deflated after my visit. Maybe it's my head spent in ABQ but the atmosphere there me off. It's an open kitchen and you sit are a bar that looks into the kitchen.  I guessed to watch them could why you eat. Hard to communicate with a friend at lunch, when your sitting next to them and have to turn your head, take a bite of food and make small talk oh and watch the ladies cook beans.  The figure was alright nothing to really comment on that stands out.  It was good.  Pricey for express type  menu.  The hot chili was not dragon spot hot but mild at best.
Heads up, this place gets super busy around lunchtime but it’s well worth it. Delicious flavorful tacos; get both the onions/cilantro and the salsa on them when they ask. You won’t regret it.

Fast service and delicious food is the game if the game here. Make sure to get a hearty helping of the green chili (best we had all trip, and backed up by local endorsements and awards!) and menudo to warm the soul on a cold day.

name: Sassafras American Eatery, Highlands
reviews: Delicious food, amazing drinks, great staff and now an even better location for the highlands spot. It's WAY bigger and quicker seating. Had a blast!!

Went here for the first time for a Birthday Brunch. The atmosphere was awesome ...I loved it! I wish they took reservations however on the weekends. Be nice if they did Open Table since we had to wait 45 minutes to be seated. This is sure a cozy comfortable space to enjoy a meal. I was expecting the food to really be phenomenal, however I was a little disappointed. The quality of the food was just so-so, along with the drinks (Mimosa/Bloody Mary). The Bloody Mary had so much ice and so much garnish that it was nearly impossible to drink. The taste of it was pretty good though once I dug though all of the stuff in it. When we got our food, the bacon was terribly under-cooked. The server was nice though and brought us some sausage to replace it, however the sausage was so salty it was hard to eat. I will say though that the remainder of the food was pretty good, especially the Breakfast Mac and Cheese which I really enjoyed! The service as well was pretty good!

A wonderful casual breakfast joint in a more residential part of the city. I think I've had better Southern brunch in other cities, but this place is still okay. The building itself is interesting and we really enjoyed the atmosphere.
Definitely one of the best brunch spots in Denver! The po boys are so good and I love the chicken fried egg. Plus all the drinks are amazing!

Simply delicious!! Sassafras is a Denver institution offering up some of the finest Cajun fair you can get. In this town! The staff are cute polite and very patient. Make sure to partake in some of the delicious cocktails they concoct for your enjoyment!

name: Kealoha's BBQ
address: 500 16th Street Mall Space 1 (fronting, H&M, Denver, CO 80202, USA
reviews: Absolutely delicious! And super friendly! We almost went somewhere else and came here instead. We are so happy we decided to try something different. Good price. Fresh made. Authentic and fresh ingredients. Noms

What an amazing surprise to find this new street vendor. Downtown Denver sorely lacks culturally authentic cuisines. This was truly refreshing to find. The owner is amazingly friendly and conversational. The food is of high quality and appropriately priced. I definitely recommend Kealoha's BBQ. I will be returning often myself!
This cart is amazing!! Super friendly service, great prices, and the food is incredible!

I’m currently eating their Loco Moco as I write this! Their food is delicious and their service is awesome. We had a larger group with us so it took a few extra minutes, but they provided us with some snacks while we waited. The snack had their Lilikoi sauce, which tastes amazing! We definitely will be coming back for more. We also got some of their pies as well, can’t wait to take a bite! Recommend them for sure!

The bbq ribs and the bbq chicken was delicious! We could barely talk about how good they were due to not wanting to stop eating. The ribs were SO tender all I had to do was pull the meat off the bone with barely any effort. The salad it comes with was also delicious. And the owners are incredibly friendly, like a true Hawaiian experience!!

name: Ultreia
reviews: The chef’s feast was divine. I highly recommend it. It’s the perfect amount for two and it ends up costing less than what you might order off the regular menu to feed two people. This meal was definitely one to remember. Even the house rosé was delightful. I cannot wait to return to this incredible venue and try more of their tapas and desserts.
Excellent food and service! The attention to detail in both the quality of food as well as staff, decor , and ambiance is not to be missed.

Great spot for tasty Spanish tapas with a very attentive staff. Located within the city’s trendy Union Station, there is plenty to choose from with zero guilt due to their small plate sizes. Bring a group or enjoy some tapas with a loved one.

This is a great place in Union Station to grab some tapas and cocktails. They have a patio and an attractive dining room, but guests are pretty casual. The menu has quite a few unique options ranging from small handhelds, to sandwiches, to fork and knife plates. Reading through the menu doesn't give you an idea of just how excellent some of their tapas are. Thankfully I had an awesome server who gave detailed descriptions and recommendations. The goat cheese stuffed dates and fried eggplants are crowd favorites and both very well- balanced, sweet and savory tapas. The cocktails come in very generous portions as well. I'd recommend ordering the chef's choice if you want to explore a variety of things, as it usually includes the most popular tapas at a better price than ordering them individually. All-around, I have nothing but good things to say about Ultreia!
Great service and amazing food.  The portions are just right to share for 2 people. We especially loved the mushrooms on the cedar plank. Will come back here again.

name: Stoic & Genuine
reviews: Went here for dinner with my mom and we both loved it! It's a smaller space but had a great atmosphere. We shared the cod cakes,they were a little on the salty side so if you don't like much salt just ask for them to not add any and they will accommodate your meal to your liking. I also had the scallops with risotto for my meal and they are the best I've tried so far. Can't wait to come back for another nice dinner.
Super fresh seafood. All of the oysters we've tried there have been delicious with very distinct flavors. The staff are extremely knowledgeable and friendly.

The food here is lovingly prepared. Excellent taste delight for your mouth. I wish I lived here so I could try everything on the menu! And let us not forget how wonderful the staff is here. It really makes it a dining experience, not just a meal!

We We’re going out for a team dinner. It was probably one of the best places I’ve been to dinner in Denver Colorado. I highly recommend the food. It is very much a seafood restaurant however everything was just impeccable. Service was perfect and good banter. They were so professional and kept our glasses topped up which is always a plus haha. I will be visiting again when next in town and simply am a big fan.

Swanky, small venue tucked inside Union Station with great atmosphere! We enjoyed some magical cocktails (average price of $15 each)...I especially enjoyed the mulled wine but loved the creativeness of everything on the cocktail menu. Wide variety of oysters, with a knowledgeable wait team to share the differences of each, were delightful. Also sampled the caviar, which was tasty with creme fresh along side.  This would be a fun place to take out-of-town guests or for a romantic evening for two. Cant wait to go back and stay for dinner.

name: Dio Mio - Handmade Pasta
reviews: There is something to be said about restaurants that focus on doing one thing extremely well. Dio Mio handmade pasta extremely well. The atmosphere definitely fun with modern music playing and a relaxed dress code for the employees. The food was absolutely perfect and if I had more time in the RiNo district i would have done my best to try the whole menu. Prices are on par with well-executed food service but they do have happy hour specials if you're looking to cut a bit of cost. If you're looking for a great dinner you should add this to your list of restaurants to try.

Definitely enjoyed this restaurant! Fun atmosphere, nice staff, stylish interior, quick service, and delicious food. The pasta dishes my fiancé and I tried had unique and tastefully created seasoning combinations that were unlike any we've had before. The bread served with the meals was delicious and well made. There were easy to access to-go boxes for the customer to box their own meals too.

My husband and I ordered take-out for a quarantine date night in. The handmade spaghetti with red sauce was so fresh with a little spicy kick to it. Our salad was also fresh and delicious with a flavorful balsamic vinaigrette. And the bread!! It was a wonderful meal and very affordable!
I’ve been going here since they first opened and it just keeps getting better every time! I love how the menu is always changes. Simply da BEST 👌🏻

Wow! This place is incredible. Caccio e Pepe is one of the best I’ve ever had. Did I mention you can get a bottle of wine for $20?!? Total Home run spot for a casual date night.

It’s order at the counter and first come first serve for seating so be on the lookout for a table or diners wrapping up when you walk in.

name: Racines Restaurant
reviews: Great atmosphere as the building is clean and very spacious. The waitstaff was very friendly and prompt. The food was good but I wouldn't say amazing. I will come back as it's tough to judge on eggs toast and bacon. Large patio that looks to make for enjoyable outdoor setting. Also a very large bar area for meeting your neighbors

Great brunch spot! Racines is known for their impressive Bloody Mary options alongside other classic boozy brunch beverages. If you're not in the mood for brunch, this place is also great for happy hour and dinner. Their menu and their space is expansive but you can expect a cozy atmosphere. Great place for meeting up with friends while nibbling on American-style eats.

Favorite neighborhood restaurant/bar in Denver. Portions are large & I’ve never had a bad meal. The staff are super friendly, attentive & go out of their way! If only there were MORE Racine’s in this world!

Arguably 1 of the BEST PLACES to eat in DTown!  Every time I have been here it has impressed.  Before a concert, just before heading home from vacay, date night, breakfast before adventure in the mile high, whatever, the place rocks from vibe, food, staff, location, valet parking, excellent bar.  The wall behind the bar, is decked out with awards and rightfully so.  Try their unbelievable mile high nachos as an appetizer.  So good, can split with 4 friends and they themselves will invoke a conversation.  I always promote this place.  Haven't been let down for doing so yet.  Enjoy♡

I have gone to Racines for years. Kind of liked the Bannnock location better with its large windows where you could see the night traffic and late hours. We would often go after the theater and have margaritas and nachos. Still it is a favorite place at the location now.

name: Odyssey Italian Restaurant
reviews: We’ve been here one other time and had a delicious dinner, came back again for our anniversary and had an amazing experience. The ambience is very romantic, rose petals on the table, violinist moving around the restraint. We had a semiprivate booth which was perfect. Our server was super attentive, and honest with her recommendation. The food was fantastic and a great wine selection. We especially loved the mussels in wine sauce and my boyfriend really enjoyed the lobster ravioli. I would definitely recommend, especially for a date night or special occasion!

Wow, what an incredible experience we had at Odyssey. As a family, we rarely eat out at Italian Restaurants and chose Odyssey for our Anniversary meal that wrapped up our 10 day road trip through Colorado. I cannot think of a better meal or experience to have culminated such a magical trip. We were able to be seated outdoors on the patio to make our meal even more delightful. The food was outstanding and the service was even better. Highly recommended.

When I moved to Denver, a friend & I were walking by looking specifically to buy bread for sauce we were making at home. We were greeted warmly by the host, then the owner. We spent time talking about my journey to Denver as a transplant, left with bread, a business card & a great memory. I came back the next week with my entire business team of 15. Before I left Denver, I probably had dinner here 10-15 times. Great hospitality, great food, excellent service. I have very fond memories of this place. Make sure you stop in here.

Amazing place,  on point true tastes of Italy and Sicilian food. Staff are always friendly and knowledgeable with amazing personality.  The house turned restaurant is warm and inviting and feels like you're coming home with all the warmth and love that vines with that.  If ever have a chance to meet the now retired original owner/head chef l, you'll fall in love with his sense if humor and charm. Truly one of our favorite places to unwind, relax with great food and awesome people.  Ther inner thing I do recommend is making reservations and if driving add plenty of extra time to find parking down one of the side streets and walking a block or 2.

Amazing place! My wife and I have been coming here for years, and the food is always so delicious and the staff is always super friendly. Got delivery during the quarantine and the food was just as tasty! They even threw in a couple tea candles for home ambiance. Thank you for all you do!

name: FNG
reviews: Great music themed restaurant. The menus are inside album covers.  We met up with friends here on a Tuesday night for a birthday gathering. There were seven of us in the party and they had no issue seating us. While we waited for everyone to show we sat at the bar. We tried a couple of the daily drink concoctions. They were very tasty.  Once seated the group ordered the Funky Hummus and Smothered Tots.  Both were tasty,  the hummus was surprisingly smoky but it was good touch. For the main course Cathy had the Rotisserie Lamb Dip   and absolutely loved it. I had the Colorado Bison Enchiladas and they were also very good. In all nobody at these table had a bad meal or drink. Highly recommended!!

The food was delicious and I really liked the rock and roll decor! My partner and I got the grilled meatloaf and the lamb dip sandwich. Both were had amazing flavor and was a great size for a lunch. We would definitely come back again in the spring and summer to hang out with the windows open.

One of my favorite places in Denver! Amazing atmosphere, friendly staff and delicious food and drinks. If you go for brunch, get the friend chicken and cakes. For lunch/dinner, I love the meatballs, all sliders, the chicken sandwich, and the chicken fried steak. For cocktails, the almost famous is among my favorite drinks ever. Well done to Troy and team

Brunch here is delicious!!! Chicken sandwich is juicy and tasty. They have unique options for brunch and it was tough to choose. Cool space inside. Definitely wanna come back with a group. Great neighborhood area to go for a small walk after, too.

We enjoyed our time at F&G. We got the smothered tots, 2 sliders (the burger and fried chicken) and the Mac & Cheese. All of the food was great and the burger slider convinced me to get the full size burger next time we go. Our server Brittany also did an awesome job. We will be visiting here again.

name: Il Posto
reviews: Delicious!  Really surprised by the mediocre reviews here because we just had the tasting menu and were blown away!  3 people, 5 stunning courses, 15 different dishes for $65 a piece?  Worth every cent.  One of the best tasting menu experiences I have had.  So good.

The food was very disappointing. Lack of flavor in anything - I had to request salt and pepper but still didn't finish any of the courses.  All three courses were also all room temperature. I couldn't tell if the calamari was supposed to be cold and wished my pasta was at least warm. Staff was friendly and it is a cool spot but that's all I can say good about my dining experience here.

Our expectations were high for our takeout during quarantine. I thought this would be a nice birthday dinner. Needless to say none of our expectations were met. We ordered food for 6 and got food enough for probably 3 people. “Cook at home” didn’t come with all ingredients nor the instructions. For as expensive as this food is, it was not worth it in any way. We expected more food and better service for the expense. Very disappointed.

Delicious food and great atmosphere. I loved that I never felt hurried and we were able to sit and enjoy conversation between courses. This was my 3rd restaurant week restaurant this week and was my absolute favorite. Definitely going to be back.
Everything was good and staff is great but nothing was exceptional. However, with its outdoor seating this is a very popular spot.

name: La Loma
reviews: Great food, and ambiance, nice dark low lighting. The music was classic and not too loud. One of my favorite Mexican Restaurants in the country. They have great appetizers and a good variety on their menu. My first time visiting the new location across from the Brown Palace, the prices are a little higher, probably to cover the new location. It’s a busy area downtown, and parking is limited but fortunately they do have valet parking.
Classic mexican restaurant in downtown Denver.   A well known establishment.  Notorious for great food and great dinning.  Highly recommend.

My wife and I had just arrived in Denver and checked into our hotel. This popped up as a recommended place due to location. We were quickly seated. My wife asked for a comparison of the sangria, and the waitress was extremely helpful. The same was excellent. The food came out quickly, and wad also excellent. I definitely would recommend the chicken and spinach quesadilla, and my wife thoroughly enjoyed her flautas. We may have to come back before this trip is over.

Been eating here for 30 plus yrs. Love the food. Not the new bldg, nor prices tho. Not cheap.  No where to park. You have to pay to park and pay to eat. So there's where it's not worth it. 
What we do is order out for pick up. One of us goes in and the other drives around. Save quite a bit. Cause no drinks, and no parking. And we only tip $2. So an 80$ bill goes down to about 45$ for 2 of us.

I highly recommend going here. The food was AMAZING. It came out quick. The service was amazing. Wyatt was our server and he was awesome. He was super nice and efficient in making sure all our needs were met. It was a great experience all around.

name: Brightmarten Restaurant & Bar
address: 730 S University Blvd, Denver, CO 80209, USA
reviews: Great experience! My wife and I came for dinner at this small but bright restaurant. We stayed absolutely satisfied with food and service. I had the salmon with mustard sauce and it was delicious. I would highly recommend!

Loved this little restaurant that's tucked away off University across the street from Bonnie Brae in the Belcaro neighborhood. Our server was fantastic. Extremely attentive and didn't hesitate to be detailed when asked for explanations. My steak was cooked to perfection (medium) and I couldn't get enough of the potatoes either. My lady got the chicken and it was season absolutely perfectly. Highly recommend.

Food was good.  I was a tad off by our waitress, by means she was great at her job, but not a friendly smile or upbeat feel.  We will be back again, but with a different server.  Hamburger was way above average and my chicken fried steak meal was above average.   The rest of the staff seemed very friendly and upbeat.  Will be returning with friends for sure.
Awesome burger and breakfast tacos. From Virginia and stopped here on the way to cherry creek mall and I’m glad I did.... AMAZING FOOD AND SERVICE

Overall good restaurant. Nice bright ambiance. The food was good - not overly large portions, but tasty. I had the avacado toast which was light and with good flavor. I added the house hit sauce which livened it up. I would put this in the above average price range with the food on the lower level of that price range. Would I recommend it? Yes. Are there better priced places for brunch? Yes.

name: The Capital Grille - Curbside Takeout & Delivery
reviews: I come here quite often and they honestly never seem to disappoint me. The whole place is spotless from top to bottom, it seems like they have someone cleaning the place 24/7 because it is very tidy and well polished up. The whole decor of the restaurant and aura makes you feel extremely comfortable and like you are eating at a top notch restaurant , which indeed you actually are!  The staff are always extremely caring and make sure they get your order right, as well as whatever else you require and also at an extremely high rate of speed which is reliable and very helpful when I don’t have too much time to sit down and eat. The food that comes out of the kitchen is absolutely mouth watering and probably some of the best food that I have not only had in Colorado but in my whole life, no exaggeration the food is really that fresh and delicious! The prices are very fair considering you get some of the BEST food that you have probably ever tasted in your lifetime. But a small quick little  warning it is a little pricey so do not expect a Denny’s or an Olive Garden pricing or quality, this is a high notch top class restaurant that not only will serve you the some of the (if not the) best food that you have ever tasted and at the fairest price as well!  Also do not even get me started on the desserts wow just wow is all I can say, they are perfect! In every way shape or form the desserts are something that I highly recommend you try if you come here! If you live within the nearby area or love spectacular food and have not been to this restaurant then you are highly missing out! This place is memorable to say the least so I highly encourage anyone who has not come here before to give it a shot because I know for a fact you will love everything about this place! If I had to give this restaurant a serious rating out of 1 through 10 it honestly deserves a 10/10 everything about this place screams “we take care of our customers”, this is the place to go if you wish to enjoy food and good company! I can not wait to come here again and fine dine some delicious food as well as be treated almost like royalty by the waiters!

The Capital Grille is certainly elegant, upscale fine dining! The ambiance is regal with classic sophistication! The food was good! I ordered the wedge salad and shrimp cocktail. I wanted more from the salad, I thought it could’ve been elevated a bit more. Everyone else in the party ordered steaks. The steaks looked beautiful and everyone enjoyed them. The service was absolutely top notch given the large party! Only hiccup was receiving my salad before the appetizer. Overall if you’re looking for an upscale evening this is the place to be.

Have not been able to try it for dinner, but for lunch it's a great spot that is the bustling area that is Larimer Square. Bartender was great as he was the one serving us. Cocktails were tasty, and the options for food were abundant. I ended up going with the special but my colleagues stuck to the menu and non of us were wrong. The calimari however was probably the most enjoyable thing we had. Insiders tip, there is valet right in front because parking is a nightmare.

We have dined in at the capital grill a few times and have never been disappointed. But the real reason for leaving this review it due to corona. With the most delightful service and  gratitude we were greeted with free delivery and an absolutely delicious meal WITH mixed drinks!! Everything arrived at our doorstep with a smile! Dirty martini with blue cheese olives, steaks cooked to perfection, beautiful sides, and great service. Will go back again and again! Thank you!!

Felt like I was walking onto the set of House of Cards with the scene set in downtown Washington DC where all all the politicos set up their behind the scenes deals. All dark oak/mahogany booths with low lighting adding to the atmosphere. Service was excellent and we were well looked after by our waitress. Extremely attentive with some excellent suggestions from the wine list and food menu. I had the lamb chops which were cooked to perfection along with a very generous portion of truffle and parmesan fries.

name: Restaurant Olivia
address: 290 S Downing St, Denver, CO 80209, USA
reviews: I bought a pan of lasagna to go and it came out AWESOME. After slapping it in the oven for an hour, it was sizzling. Such a great comfort food, you guys knocked it out of the park! The ingredients were fresh and delicious. Can’t wait to order more from this restaurant.

The food was perfect. We ordered the Filet Mignon Oscar and the Snapper. Best food my wife and I have had in a very long time. Everything was cooked to perfection. Service was fantastic. Natalie was amazing. She went out of her way to make a drink for my wife they never had on the drink menu. She was always smiling and very polite. We will be back often.

Oh, my goodness!!  I got takeout tonight and was blown away by how good the food was!  The pasta bolognese was delicious!  The lasagna was like anything I've ever had.  And the focaccia bread with whipped butter incredible.  This was my first time ordering from Restaurant Olivia and I will definitely order again.  We noticed an adorable handwritten "thank you" note from the owner's daughter in the bag.  So cute!!

We went to 5280 online to search up local restaurants and check out different menus.  One of the things that jumped out from Olivia's website is that you can opt to add a $10 donation to your order and they will give a four-person pasta kit to a family in need. Also, if you buy a $100 gift card, they will give you an additional $25 gift card.   I really think it's more important than ever to support our local restaurants and businesses :)

The food is consistently fresh, innovative and delicious!  Be sure to try the cocktails and wine, as both are well curated and crafted.  The only downside is the parking; use the valet, or if you plan to drink much, call an Uber.
Giving it a 4 because of the ambience. Super romantic, beautiful place. Sit on the patio. It's mostly all dates here. You can absolutely dress up. Food is very mediocre and pricey. Service was good.

name: Linger
reviews: Wasn't impressed. Nice ambiance but their brunch was definitely underwhelming. Very basic menu items for inflated prices. Hardly a brunch menu, mostly was like lunch with some eggs & 1 french toast option. Not for me personally. Go elsewhere for brunch. Endless mimosas are poured super heavy though!! And very very tasty!

Only went here for drinks, but it was awesome. Super packed until it started to slow down around 10 or 11pm. I don't know the bartenders name but he was awesome. He created drinks that were amazing art and chemistry. Shoot out to him and his creativity skills! Had a dark chocolate orange, elderflower,  and Andes mint martinis. All were delicious and he shared the story of the owners bigger picture with us.

What an amazing experience! I took my wife for her birthday and man it blew me away honestly! The menu is kind of confusing but everything I’ve tried made my mouth drop in awe. Very clever menu and the best waiter I’ve ever had! Name was Ethan. Never had a waiter so informative and caring. 5 star service and 5 start food. Will definitely be back! Ethan deserves a raise! 🤘🏻

I've been enjoying this establishment for many years, Every time is a new adventure.
The atmosphere is perfect for a business lunch or first date.
Food is exquisite and drinks are as well.
You will be paying for the quality no doubt.
If you plan to have dinner on at a peak time make reservations for sure..

This was amazing! With a restaurant like this it's as much about the experience as it is the food. Having said that, both here were well above the average. The service was too notch even though it was busy AF!
We ordered a couple large and small dishes each. Had a couple drinks. And even ordered dessert. We couldn't finish everything. Didn't hardly touch one of the big dishes except to try it. 
The worst thing we ate would've been the best at most other restaurants. Even the sweet potato waffle fries with Chipotle ketchup were 👌.
Most of the large dishes were a little less than $20, smaller dishes $8-15, and there were a couple dishes on the higher prices side (still below $30).
They had a lot of vegan, gluten free options as well.
This is a place we will definitely go back to!

You're welcome😁

name: The Kitchen American Bistro
reviews: The Kitchen Bistro in Denver was a hit with my family due to its farm to table food. Seafood flown in daily. All quality fresh ingredients; all the food delivered to my table had a stylish presentation and taste. The brick walls give the place a wonderfully warm atmosphere. I expect everything would be good here. The grilled sea bass with beans was exceptional as was the Brussels sprouts. Service was attentive and helpful. Full bar. Good wines by the glass.

Really a very good higher end restaurant in Denver. Got to talk to the assistant manager and had only one issue... Not a complaint!  I won't post it here since I am sure it was a "one off" thing with my order. But everything was pretty much spot on!  Definitely give this place a try if you are in the area.
Denver restaurant week was wonderful. We loved all the food. My friend and I were there for 3 hours eating food and chatting. Had a wonderful time.

Simple salad done in best possible way. Nice dressing and right amount of the sour and salt to bring up the fresh veggies flavors. Farm to table, good egg and hash brown.  Mimosa is the only thing I don’t enjoy as much. Too much bubble. Other than that, it’s fantastic.

I came here for a private party and everything was phenomenal. We were served family style courses and the food was top notch. Great atmosphere right in the heart of Denver. Kelsey- our server- went above and beyond. He provided great wine recommendations, and made sure our glasses were never empty. If you're looking to book a private dinner party, this is your place.

name: SuperMegaBien
reviews: Love the atmosphere and concept. True Dim Sum plates, which come around to be immediately plucked off a tray. It’s great because you get to see all the options. Super fresh, great flavors. Will be back, highly recommend!

This place was the sweetest surprise. 
I’d been wanting to try it out, but hadn’t made plans yet. My girlfriend and I were having drinks at Death & Co next door and needed some food, so we stubbles next door and totally fell in love. Amazing food, lovely staff, delicious drinks and the atmosphere does it all. 
Do yourself a favor and stop in here!
What a great place for a group.   You can try a bit of everything.      All of the food was excellent!   Especially liked the pork entree.   It is loud, but that is what makes the party atmosphere.

Delectable tapas... Every single dish was excellent! We stuffed ourselves. The purple Marg wasn't worth $13 in my opinion, but everything else made up for it, including the incredible wait staff and service! Definitely check out the happy hour... It's a steal!

Super mega good on the interior design and mood - funky, artsy, edgy, Latin inspired with a hint of Chinese influence (just look at the rice-to-go-box reception desk). Cool dim sum concept for Latin American eats, but because of the concept, some dishes could be a bit more fresher..still a very delightful experience!

name: Morin
reviews: Incredible experience here! The food is spectacular and the staff is warm and welcoming with exceptional customer service! It's a place you must go and enjoy!!! Everything was wonderful but the smoked beet dish was especially magical!

This place was amazing! The food was spectacular, and the server was very intelligent and he knew what he was doing. The menu offers many different types of food and drink, and the desert menu is amazing! The atmosphere is great, and the overall experience is one you will surely remember. Make sure to find a way to go to this restaurant.

Morin was phenomenal.  New favorite French restaurant in west of the Mississippi.   Get the west and east coast oysters, extra fresh shaved horseradish.  The gnocchi was incredible as was the filet and full fish special.  Excellent wine selection and loved their spin on a Manhattan with the cognac infusion.  You won't be disappointed.
Great oysters.  Beef short ribs were excellent.  The atmosphere is fun and sophisticated.  A bit pricey, but the food was really good.   Service was great.

I absolutely love this place.  I think Morin is my new favorite Denver restaurant.  It's a nice little small space with a friendly casual vibe.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  What I love most is the food.  The kitchen really seems to know what they are doing.  I've had the duck breast and bavette steak.   Both were cooked to perfection with delicious sauces.  It is a bit pricey, but the portion sizes are quite good.  I will be visiting often.

name: Ocean Prime
reviews: We went for restaurant week and honestly I was super impressed. This place has the perfect vibe, service quality, and delicious food. Our server was awesome and it was exactly the experience you would hope for from an upscale restaurant. I don't eat fish at all and still found plenty to love! Try the berries and bubbles drink - super cool!

The food here is delicious. I gave four stars because I wish the restaurant had been quieter, it was pretty hard to hear and understand my waiter. That is my only complaint, though. Everything I ate here was truly very good. I had the goat cheese ravioli, the chicken entree, and butter cake for dessert. The ravioli was creamy and soft. It was pretty rich. The chicken was cooked perfectly, the skin was crispy and nicely spiced, it paired really well with the sauce. The spinach salad was absolutely fantastic, those homemade croutons were a great touch. And the butter cake was rich and sweet and was amazing with the homemade ice cream and raspberry sauce. The waiter was kind and his support man was very attentive. We didn't want for anything.

Fantastic. Upscale. Worth the money. The drinks were amazing and so was everything we ate. I had the scallops and he got the lamb. We also hot the steak tartar and the cheese fondue. You have to try this place for date night/special occasions.

Made a reservation for a birthday celebration and everything went smooth. Excellent service  from beginning to end. Delicious food and delicious interesting drinks. The calamari appetizer was one of my favorites, great flavor and perfect crispiness.

Everything was wonderful! The servers, the bartender, the atmosphere and the food. Our server Carolyn was so friendly and accommodating, I requested a drink that was not on the menu and the bartender went above and beyond to research the drink and made it deliciously. We ordered the ribeye steak and it was cooked to perfection. The sides were twice baked and black truffle mac n cheese and they were delicious.  Highly recommend this place.

name: duo Restaurant
reviews: I was very impressed with this place. My girlfriend has a nut allergy and they were accommodating with menu items and adjusted them to be allergy safe. The food was delicious! The short ribs fell off the bone and the sweet potatoes were outstanding! Dylan who helped me was very personable and friendly. The chocolate mousse dessert was light but very rich and flavorful. We can’t wait to go back!

Overall a good atmosphere to bring friends, family or your date to. It was a little hot in the building which kind of dampened the overall experience but the food was great. The cheese plate was amazing and everything paired very well together. Their lamb entree was cooked as described and carried some mild flavor as well. The Bison entree was my top recommendation. Cooked super well and plenty of flavor to go around. Salmon was "delicious" as well. Nice cozy vibe, not too loud. It would be nice if the AC worked a little better though 😉! Would recommend.
We had a great dinner here during restaurant week. Enjoyed every single item and look forward to coming back.

I had come to Duo a while ago for brunch, loved it and completely forgot about their dinner service until we were thinking to celebrate my dad’s birthday and were looking for an American farm to table restaurant in the neighborhood. We booked Duo and proceeded to have one of the best meals we’ve had in Denver, complete with rich bone marrow complimented by gorgeous pickles, mussels with a complex and delicious broth, 3 amazing  entrees: the chicken, trout, cassoulet. Every single one was full of flavor, fresh and beautifully presented. The service was wonderful, and the server’s suggestions were helpful and they went out of their way to accommodate us. It was so rewarding to see how much this restaurant clearly prides itself on serving delicious food with superb service, and I was super impressed. It’s earned it’s place as one of the best meals I’ve had in Denver, and I will be adding this to my list of places I will be coming back to soon. Thank you for making our night SO special!
Duo is awesome. I go there quite often and it never disappoints!!  They have decreased the number of tables to allow for ‘social distancing’ so I felt quite comfortable. Go and enjoy with NO fear!

name: City O' City
reviews: A local friend recommended this spot a while back. I finally got around to visiting and I'M IN LOVE!! As someone who is gluten intolerant (and occasionally adopts the vegetarian / vegan lifestyle), City O' City blew me away. Great prices, incredible variety, amazing service, and a cozy atmosphere. The portions were perfect if not generous. I could hype this place up forever! I got the chicken (cauliflower) and waffles and a mocha on the side. Everything tasted out of this world. Nothing left me even close to disappointed. The batter on the cauliflower us just a bomb of flavor. My friend got the burrito and enjoyed it as well, even as someone who does not partake in the vegetarian lifestyle. I can't wait to come back to Denver just to hit up City O' City again! 🙌😍

Awesome restaurant! This was my first time experiencing City O' City. I had high expectations after eating at their other restaurant Watercourse Foods. We waited a few minutes to sit, but the service was wonderful. The food was delicious! We ordered the large sausage and peppers pizza with the vegan cashew ricotta and the fried ravioli. Originally I figure we would have leftovers, but the food was so good we ate it all. Thank you for a wonderful dining experience!

Looks like cauliflower is getting a comeback. Love how they spice everything and add the right flower to these tacos 🌮. So amazing m, one of my favorite vegan places in Denver. Loved to walk to this place when I lived in capital hill. The coffee and the baked good are awesome as well to come and relax. The decorations add a nice ambience.

Amazing vegan food! I was told by every vegan friend who's been to Denver that I must go here and to Watercourse Foods (same owner). They gave me great advice! City O' City is one of the very best vegan restaurants I've been to and I've been to many of them. The great bar selections, the excellent staff, food and wonderfully unique atmosphere are all on-point all-the-way!
Note: next door is a bakery owned by the same folks with soft serve vegan ice cream too. It's amazing as well!

Great spot. I’m from Jersey, the friends I was with are from Atlanta and it was just a good time.  I loved the food, the chicken and waffles were delicious, the fried ravioli as well. decent coffee and wonderful service. I really enjoyed the art one the walls. They feature an artist every month I believe. Music was good, I’d recommend a visit if you’re in town.

name: Sushi Ronin Denver - Sushi and Sake Bar
reviews: Food was really good, but the staff is what makes this place great. You can tell these people enjoy their jobs and as someone who has worked in the industry it is great to see! Thank you for a lovely evening, the recommendations on where to visit after dinner, and laughs! I didn't get our server's name but he had a great smile, hot beard, and super sweet...and to his coworker that had a butt to die for...you're fab! Thanks again guys! Hope to visit again some time soon!

Arrived solo at 5:30 pm on a misting Thursday evening and sat at the sushi bar. Given the early dinner there were only a few other patrons at the cocktail bar, sushi bar and tables combined.

The ambience was welcoming, with Edison lights and big open windows. I was quickly greeted by one of the sushi chefs with a small cucumber salad before deciding on getting Chirashi ($28).

It came with miso soup and a salad. The soup was standard miso, and the salad had fresh greens and wonderful vinaigrette. As soon as I was finished the chef, who I watched prepare the Chirashi dish, had it ready and walked me through each piece.

For Denver, the sushi was fresh, the presentation was superb and I was completely satisfied by the portion size. Well worth the money and immediately a place I want to come back to.

Highly recommend for friends, informal business gatherings and even a casual date spot.

This place is my favorite. I visit a lot of restaurants but to this restaurant I  constantly return again and again. The team is very affectionate and the cuisine they serve is so yummy. I never miss an opportunity to have a decent dinner in this place. I recommend this place with pleasure.

Went for a birthday dinner. We had a great time! Sat at the sushi bar, so it was great to watch everything be made, and see other dishes be made, definitely makes one interested in trying different things. The food was excellent and I was very happy with all the dishes we ordered. Very comfortable setting, not too loud or too quiet. Great list of different Sake and drinks to order. Right next to El Five which is a great place to grab a drink before hand. I will be back in the future!

New favorite place ❤ Great people are here. Delicious Sushi, Great feel and atmosphere & Hot Sake; what else can I say? I had a wonderful time. Located in an exciting area that is fun and lively.  Big Thank You to Jason for the good conversation.

name: Old Major
reviews: Crowded for brunch, but service is friendly and attentive. Tried their Chicken & Waffle. 2 pieces of dark meat perfectly fried, tender and juicy. Waffle is thin and buttery, meant as a vessel for the chicken more than an equal part of the plate. Main thing that stood out to me is the maple syrup was served in a small warmed container, ensuring it remains easily pourable during your meal. Maple syrup itself was also great quality, brings the plate together well. White gravy was so-so, I'm more of a brown gravy person.
Really great bourbon selection, food is on point and delicious. The neighborhood is adorable with a local butcher shop next door. Loved this brunch!

service, food, drinks, and prices were incredible. I highly recommend this place. I went here for my birthday dinner and I was grinning the whole time because I loved everything about it. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. The staff is super great too. I recommend any meat place but especially the 3 pound pork.

What an experience! So comfortable, yet stylish. Our server was quick, shared his favourites without being asked, and kept us smiling throughout. The ham and biscuits appetizer was perfect, light fluffy biscuits flavored with cheddar surrounding thinly sliced ham that was some of the best I've ever tasted. My wife's hanger steak was cooked perfectly, and seasoned just as well. The "Nose to Tail" entree was equally impressive, with a house-made sausage, well rendered belly meat, crispy pig ears, and a rib that made my day. The oysters were easily the best I've had in Denver. A butterscotch pot de creme with the best shortbread cookie ever rounded out our meal. We will be back.

Service was next level and the food was so good. Went for brunch with some friends and had a wonderful time, the server worked with my request for a side salad that wasn't on the menu as a side salad, it was INCREDIBLE and I am so glad he and the kitchen were willing to be flexible. My eggs Benedict was very delicious also. I plan to come back again soon.

name: Uchi Denver
reviews: First time out since our daughter was born and it was absolutely the right choice for this night. The server was very knowledgeable and made great sake suggestions along with being able to guide us through the menu. She suggested the chefs tasting menu since it was our first time visiting, and after going through it, I would recommend  anyone else who wants to see what Uchi is about to do the same. The food was beautifully plated, and some of the best fish dishes we have had.

Great food. The service is also very good. Went for my wife’s birthday. We had food from the regular menu as well as the happy hour menu. Everything was was good. Our favorites were the happy hour albacore and the mushroom dish. I am very much a meat eater but the mushroom vegetarian dish was my favorite. We had the fried milk and banana cake dessert. We all loved the banana cake desert. It is very coffee forward but delicious. 

This is my favorite sushi restaurant in the downtown area.

This was one of the most exquisite dining experiences ever. These were the tastiest, most amazing tastes I’ve ever had. So many nuanced flavors. Grazing through the menu is fantastic.  Depend on your server to guide you through. Thank you Andrew and team for making our NYE very special. Your graciousness and excitement about Uchi helped to make an amazing night!

Not sure what all the hype is about. We finally gave this place and try and while the atmosphere was very cool the portions were so small and overpriced! They have a special vegetarian menu which is great, however, many of the things can’t be made vegan so the options are slim. We paid $18 for a small, bite size piece of tofu, and then another $18 for a small bowl of grilled veggies with rice. The sushi pieces themselves were about the size of a quarter in circumference which I have never seen before and I have dined at many higher end sushi restaurant all over Denver. We ended up spending $100 just to to fill up and it was not really worth it. The food itself was very good, but there was not much of it. Could think of many other places we could have gone for that price to have a dinner. This is great place if you want to have a few small plates and a drink, but not a dinner. I hope they can increase their portion sizes somewhat for what they are charging and have a little bit more variety. I don’t think I’ll be returning.

Uchi is phenomenal. The food is incredible - and the milk balls is the best way to end the night. Staff was accommodating for my wife’s birthday, and recommended the perfect mix and amount of food. 

I rarely eat fish, but get it every time at Uchi.

name: Bistro Vendôme
address: 1420 Larimer St UNIT 1705, Denver, CO 80202, USA
reviews: Amazing food! Looks and tastes just like a real french bistro!! Give it a try, you won't regret it! (Also, the chocolate souffle will change your life)
Food was delicious!  Service was amazing! And scenery is beautiful! We dined 'outside'between the shops and the restaurant. They painted the ceiling to look like the sky.

An interesting restaurant. While we were a large group, and only ordered from a set menu, the dishes were well liked, and the wine selection was appropriate. I even had a plant based meal made of potatoes in a cilantro based sauce that was tasty. While this is named with French names, don't expect them to speak French.

I love this place. It's a small, unassuming French restaurant off Larimer.  They have a great wine selection, ever changing food menu and quaint feel.

This is a great place to have a special date or a large party.

You can also sit at their bar. It's small, so plan ahead, but they have great happy hour specials for food and drink, so it's also a great place to stop in for a drink and quick bite before a show.

Food and atmosphere are incredible! Waitstaff has for the most part been excellent except for our last visit. Our main waiter made us feel invisible.... will be back again to give it another chance because it’s like stepping back to France.  One recommendation would be to have French music playing in the background instead of “today’s hits” or maybe even have live music in the courtyard in good weather?
